entry.summary: 除了每年新机型背面不断增加的相机镜头块或“用 iPhone 拍摄”广告活动之外，还有什么比这更能证明相机对 iPhone 的独特重要性呢？专用的硬件按钮？
entry.content:
史蒂夫·乔布斯 (Steve Jobs) 2007 年推出初代 iPhone 时，众多令人难忘的时刻之一就是这张幻灯片，展示了当时市场上四款领先的智能手机。乔布斯解释道：

现在，为什么我们需要革命性的用户界面？这是四部智能手机，对吗？摩托罗拉 Q、黑莓、Palm Treo、诺基亚 E62——这些都是常见的嫌疑人。而且，他们的用户界面有什么问题？嗯，他们的问题确实是在倒数 40 名中。就是这个东西就在那里。他们都有这些键盘，无论您是否需要它们都在那里。它们都具有固定在塑料中的控制按钮，并且对于每种应用程序都是相同的。嗯，每个应用程序都需要一个稍微不同的用户界面，一组稍微优化的按钮，只是为了它。

如果六个月后你想到一个好主意，会发生什么？你不能到处跑，给这些东西添加一个按钮。他们已经发货了。那么你做什么呢？它不起作用，因为按钮和控件无法更改。它们无法针对每个应用程序进行更改，并且如果您想到要添加到此产品中的另一个好主意，它们也无法在以后进行更改。

那么，你如何解决这个问题呢？唔。事实证明，我们已经解决了这个问题。 20年前我们用计算机解决了这个问题。我们用位图屏幕解决了这个问题，它可以显示我们想要的任何内容。放置任何用户界面。还有指点设备。我们用鼠标解决了这个问题。我们解决了这个问题。那么我们如何将其应用到移动设备上呢？我们要做的就是去掉所有这些按钮，只制作一个巨大的屏幕。一个巨大的屏幕。

当时，最激进的做法似乎是放弃硬件QWERTY键盘，转而在软件中实现触摸屏键盘。微软时任首席执行官史蒂夫·鲍尔默 (Steve Ballmer)在一段臭名昭著的视频中，在被问及看到 iPhone 的反应后，他哈哈大笑：“500 美元？全额补贴，有计划吗？我说，这是世界上最昂贵的手机，它对商业客户没有吸引力，因为它没有键盘，这使得它不是一个很好的电子邮件机器。”

当然，苹果并没有取消所有按钮。但他们保留的按钮都是为了系统、设备，而不是为了任何特定的应用：电源、音量、静音开关（奇怪的是，几乎没有竞争对手复制），以及正面唯一的按钮：Home 。 1就是这样。

当苹果的竞争对手不再嘲笑 iPhone 并开始复制它时，他们放弃了硬件键盘——迄今为止，这是区分“智能手机”与普通手机的主要标志——但他们无法让自己消除不是一个而是两个专用键盘。在他们缺乏想象力的头脑中，硬件按钮是使任何手机成为电话所固有的：绿色的“通话”按钮和红色的“挂断”按钮。 Android 手机有那些红色/绿色按钮。黑莓 Storm 也有这些功能。除了 iPhone 之外的每部手机都有它们。直到他们赶上并意识到这些按钮也被取消了。

这种想法可能源于这些设备的名称。当然，所有手机——哑巴手机、黑莓风格的硬件键盘手机、iPhone 风格的触摸屏手机——都应该有电话按钮。我怀疑他们非常深入地思考了苹果如何大胆地放弃硬件键盘而采用全触摸屏设计，但他们认为苹果只是通过回避绿色/红色硬件呼叫按钮将极简主义发挥到了极致。无论他们做了多少其他事情，他们首先是手机——它就在他们的名字里！

但 iPhone 从来都不是真正的电话。在 iPhone 上，电话始终只是另一个应用程序。毫无疑问，这是一个特殊的应用程序。默认放置在主屏幕底部的 Dock 中。在高度受限的操作系统中的特殊后台权限，当您返回主屏幕时，大多数应用程序都会有效退出。来电瞬间占据了整个屏幕。乔布斯在介绍中花了很多时间演示电话应用程序，其中包括可视语音邮件，这是一项真正的突破性功能，需要 AT&T/Cingular 在后端进行合作。 2

但是，iPhone 的电话部分无论是现在还是现在都只是一个应用程序。如果将 iPhone 与 iPod Touch 进​​行比较，iPhone 硬件上没有任何东西表明它比 iPod Touch 更像是一款手机，而 iPod Touch 不仅不是手机，甚至不提供蜂窝网络。当然，没有按钮。没有伸出的天线。设备上没有运营商徽标。看看现代的 iPhone，实际上只有一项功能的用途可以通过显眼的硬件突出物清晰可见：相机镜头。五年前，在我对 iPhone 11 的评论中，我写道：“几周前，在我的播客上，推测今年新款 iPhone 的主打功能时，我说‘iCamera’会更合适。”比‘iPhone’更重要的名字。”

除了每年新机型背面不断增加的相机镜头块，或者“ Shot on iPhone ”广告活动——运行时间最长（并且仍在进行中）之外，还有什么比这更能证明相机对 iPhone 的独特重要性呢？ ）苹果历史上的活动？专用的硬件按钮？

相机控制

简单的看法是，苹果已经耗尽了硬件创意，现在每年只在 iPhone 上添加一个新按钮——去年是“操作”按钮，今年是“相机控制”，也许明年他们最终会添加那些绿色/红色的电话按钮。但这低估了苹果在 iPhone 第 18 次年度硬件迭代中添加专用于单个应用程序的硬件按钮的激进程度。

我指的是一般意义上的应用程序，而不仅仅是应用程序意义上的应用程序。当然，默认情况下，按“相机控制”会启动 iOS 相机应用程序， 3但在设置任何新的 iPhone 16 时，Apple 自己的入门屏幕将其目的描述为启动“相机应用程序”，并带有小写c 。任何采用新 API 和指南的第三方应用程序都可以充当由 Camera Control 启动（并且一旦启动后进行控制）的相机应用程序。 （不过，我将默认撰写有关使用系统相机应用程序的文章。）

苹果似乎从未将相机控制称为“按钮”，但它确实是一个按钮。你可以看到它按下去，即使在设备关闭时它也会发出咔哒声（不像以前的 iPhone 上的触觉 Touch ID Home 按钮和老旧的 iPhone SE）。但它不仅仅是一个按钮。您可以将其视为两个物理控件合二为一：微型触觉触控板和实际点击按钮。

当相机应用程序尚未处于拍摄模式时（无论您的 iPhone 处于锁定屏幕还是其他应用程序处于活动状态，或者即使您正在相机应用程序内执行除拍摄之外的其他操作，例如查看现有照片） ）：

  • 完全单击相机控制按钮可启动相机应用程序并进入拍摄模式。
  • 轻按不会触发任何内容，也不会提供任何触觉反馈。仅当您在相机应用程序中准备拍摄时，轻按才会执行某些操作。

当相机应用程序处于活动状态并准备拍摄时：

  • 完全单击“相机控制”按钮可拍摄照片或启动视频，具体取决于您当前的模式。 （如果您处于静态照片模式，单击并按住“相机控制”将启动视频，就像按住屏幕上的快门按钮一样。）
  • 轻按“相机控制”会打开一个覆盖层，您可以通过向左滑动手指进行骑行来调整当前设置模式，就像触控板一样。
  • 轻按相机控制按钮可更改叠加层以调整要调整的设置。选项包括：曝光、深度（f-stop）、变焦、相机、风格、色调。

光是把这些都写出来就听起来很复杂，而且确实有点复杂。 （这是苹果公司自己的使用相机控制的图解指南。）相机很复杂。但如果你把它捣碎，它就会拍出一张照片。相机控制就像相机应用程序本身的缩影。只想瞄准并射击？简单的。想要摆弄 f-stops 和风格吗？有一个周到的用户界面来启用它。在 iPhone 的早期， Apple 的相机应用程序确实是简单的傻瓜相机。拍摄界面只有几个按钮：快门、照片/视频切换、闪光灯控制以及切换到前置摄像头的切换。最初的 iPhone 和 iPhone 3G 甚至不支持视频，前置摄像头直到 iPhone 4 才出现。那些旧 iPhone 的摄像头硬件很简单，应用程序也体现了这种简单性。

苹果的现代相机硬件已经变得非常复杂，相机应用程序也是如此。但如果您只想拍摄取景器中看到的内容，那就一如既往的简单。捏合变焦，点击对焦，按下快门按钮拍摄。但还有许多其他控件和选项，随时可用并智能地呈现给那些需要它们的人，而那些不需要它们的人很容易忽略。苹果的相机应用程序是世界上最好的、设计最好的软件之一。可以说，它也是世界上被复制最多的界面。你很难找到一款高级 Android 手机，其内置相机应用程序看起来不像苹果的，通常甚至连文本标签的黄色强调色都没有。

使用几台 iPhone 16 评测设备一周多后，我对相机控制的总结是，需要一段时间才能习惯——我觉得我还在习惯它——但它已经感觉像是我不想要的东西没有。这是一个好主意，也是一个大胆的主意。正如我上面强调的，只有在第 18 次硬件修订版中，苹果才添加了专用于单个应用程序的硬件控制。我不希望苹果再次这样做。我确实希望苹果的竞争对手会无耻地模仿相机控制。

不过，一开始我对摄像机控制的物理位置感到沮丧。作为一名自 20 世纪 90 年代末以来一直使用专用相机进行拍摄的业余摄影师，我的右手食指预计快门按钮位于右上角附近。但Camera Control 的中心距离角点为2 英寸（5 厘米）。我永远不会停止希望它离角落更近，但一周后我已经习惯了它的实际位置。我明白了。我已经足够大了，我可以用宽屏方向拍摄所有视频和大部分照片。但如今的社交媒体以高屏视频为主。正如苹果公司的 Piyush Pratik 在上周的主题演讲中所解释的那样，相机控制设计用于宽（横向）和高（纵向）方向。将其移向角落（我的手指想要的位置）会更适合宽屏拍摄，但在高处拍摄时握住 iPhone 会变得非常不稳定。我不愿意承认，但我认为苹果的定位是正确的。高屏拍摄太流行了。而且，仅仅一周后，我的食指就越来越习惯它的位置。不过，对于手较小的人来说，这可能有点困难。

当我的 iPhone 被锁定时，使用相机控制来启动相机也让我感到有点沮丧。在默认设置下，当您的 iPhone 解锁或锁定但屏幕处于唤醒状态时，只需单击“相机控制”即可直接进入相机应用程序中的拍摄模式。这听起来很明显，而且确实如此。但是，当您的 iPhone 被锁定且屏幕关闭或处于常亮模式时，单击“相机控制”只会唤醒屏幕。屏幕唤醒后，您必须再次单击它才能跳转到拍摄模式。苹果公司的想法很明显：他们希望防止在口袋或钱包中意外点击“相机控制”时打开相机。与 iPhone 上几乎所有其他模式不同的是，当您在相机中处于拍摄模式时，设备不会在一两分钟不活动后自动进入睡眠状态。事实上，iOS 18 当前的默认设置是在 30 秒后自动锁定。 （设置→显示和亮度→自动锁定。）在拍摄模式下，相机应用程序将在进入睡眠状态之前长时间保持打开状态。您不希望当您的 iPhone 放在口袋里时无意中发生这种情况。

但上周我遇到的情况是，我的 iPhone 放在口袋里，我看到一些转瞬即逝的东西，我想拍摄。这种情况在我和妻子上周五参加的威泽音乐会上反复发生。 （很棒的表演。）我想要的是从口袋里拿出 iPhone 时单击相机控制，并在我将它放在眼前时准备好拍摄。这就是像我的理光 GR IIIx 这样的专用相机上的开/关按钮的工作原理。但对于 iPhone 16，通常情况下，从口袋里拿出 iPhone 时单击“相机控制”只会唤醒屏幕，而不会使其进入拍摄模式。我需要再次单击它才能进入拍摄模式。稍纵即逝的瞬间，就足以错过你想要拍摄的镜头。这一切的全部意义在于成为一名快速的枪手。

Apple 在“设置”→“相机”→“相机控制”→“启动相机”中提供了更具保护性的选项，要求双击（而不是单击）来启动指定的相机应用程序。在我写这篇文章时，我希望他们还提供一个保护性较低的选项，即使手机被锁定且屏幕关闭，也始终只需单击一下即可启动相机应用程序。一种“我会通过意外点击来碰碰运气”的选项。不过，苹果可能尝试过这一点，并发现无意的点击太常见了。但就目前情况而言，没有什么好办法总是尽快进入拍摄模式。

当 iPhone 锁定且屏幕关闭时，双击相机控制即可进入拍摄模式。我在周末开始这样做，起初我认为这满足了我的愿望。但问题是，如果 iPhone 被锁定但屏幕已经唤醒，双击“相机控制”将在第一次单击时跳入“相机”，并用第二次单击拍照。因此，我不得不删除至少六张模糊的意外镜头。

可以避免意外调用的手势是单击并按住“相机控制”按钮。理论上，苹果可以提供这样一种可靠的方式：从口袋里拿出 iPhone 就可以启动相机。但苹果公司为视觉智能保留了点击并按住的手势，这是上周宣布的一项新的苹果智能功能。这一功能将为诸如Humane 的 AI Pin和Rabbit 的 R1等专用“AI”设备敲响棺材。即使在 iOS 18.1 的开发者测试版中，视觉智能尚不可用，但点击并按住手势已为其保留。 4

因此，在撰写本文时，我尝试记住在从口袋里拿出 iPhone 进行拍摄时只双击“相机控制”，并且在双击“相机”时偶尔会出现模糊的不需要的镜头，只是将其吸收掉。控制屏幕何时唤醒。我可以想到尝试的唯一其他技术是记住始终等到看到屏幕唤醒后单击“相机控制”，如有必要，请倾斜手机以唤醒它，但这似乎会破坏进入拍摄模式的目的，因为尽快。

默认情况下，如果轻按“相机控制”，几乎所有 UI 元素都会从取景器屏幕上消失。拍摄模式选择器（电影、视频、照片、人像、空间等）、变焦按钮（0.5×、1×、2×、5×）、前置/后置摄像头切换、最近照片的缩略图——所有这些都从屏幕上消失了，就像原来的 iPhone 相机界面一样整洁。将其视为将相机控制用作快门按钮时的半按。几十年来，专用硬件相机一直提供工作原理类似的两级快门按钮。使用这些专用相机，您可以半按以锁定焦距和曝光；然后您可以移动相机重新构图，同时保持焦距和曝光锁定，然后完全按下拍摄图像。苹果承诺在“今年晚些时候”的软件更新中将此功能引入所有 iPhone 16 型号的相机应用程序中。 （iOS 18.1 beta 4 中尚未实现。）相机控制的感觉与真正的两级快门按钮（在两个不同的按压点上物理点击）完全相同，但最终可能会在未来的 iPhone 型号中实现。

相机控制的一个问题是，由于它是电容式的，因此对于外壳制造商来说很棘手。显而易见的解决方案是在其周围放置一个切口，让用户的手指触摸实际的相机控制按钮。苹果公司更优雅的解决方案是“蓝宝石水晶，与导电层耦合，将手指运动传达给相机控制”，采用自己的硅胶和透明外壳以及其子公司 Beats 的新型光滑聚碳酸酯外壳。这听起来不像是你在 20 美元的便宜盒子里看到的东西。在我的测试中，无论是苹果手机壳还是 Beats 手机壳，它都运行得相当流畅。不过，我确实认为你会失去一些轻按触觉反馈的感觉。最终，Camera Control 比以往任何时候都更加真实地表明，使用 iPhone 的最佳方式就是不戴保护壳。

关于相机控制的另一件事。在可通过相机控制调节的功能中（同样：曝光、深度（f-stop）、变焦、相机、风格、色调），“相机”是一个很容易被忽视的突出部分。缩放提供从 0.5× 到 25.0× 的连续小数增量。也就是说，你可以滑动手指来获得像 1.7×、3.3×、17.4× 等缩放值。我几乎不想这样。我想坚持精确的真实光学增量：0.5×、1×、2×和5×。这就是“相机”设置模式所提供的功能。将其视为缩放，但仅限于那些精确的值。 （此设置可以称为“镜头”，而不是“相机”，但这可能会造成混淆，因为 1× 和 2× 都来自同一物理镜头；区别在于传感器数据的处理方式。）事实上，我希望我可以进入“设置”并从“相机控制”中的可用功能列表中禁用“缩放”。如果我真的想要非光学变焦级别，我可以使用现有的屏幕界面选项。

显而易见的是，Camera Control 显然是由 Apple 内部的摄影爱好者构思、设计和制造的，他们非常熟悉专用相机的工作原理和使用感受。在政治上，它肯定是由同一个团体所支持的。令人震惊的是，现在所有新 iPhone 上都有专门用于摄影的硬件控制，而且是机械上复杂的控制。

摄影，除了相机控制

像往常一样，我将把它留给其他评测者对图像质量进行深入的像素窥视比较，但在我看来，iPhone 16 Pro（我过去每天驾驶的评测设备）就足够了周）相机看起来和平常一样好。

今年的重大新摄影功能与镜头或传感器无关。它是下一代摄影风格，而且它实际上是“对于我们其他人来说是 RAW”。这一直是我个人摄影迷/热情的边缘。我非常关心摄影，几十年来购买了许多价值数千美元的相机（和镜头），但拍摄 RAW 从来没有让我坚持过。我了解它是什么，以及为什么它在技术上优于拍摄 JPEG/HEIC，但它的工作量太大了。 RAW 可让您通过后期手动冲洗获得更好的结果，但您必须在后期进行冲洗，因为原始 RAW 图像（抱歉）看起来非常平坦且不饱和。有一段时间，我尝试拍摄 RAW + JPEG，其中拍摄的每张图像都存储为直接来自传感器的 RAW 文件和经过相机成像管道的 JPEG 文件，但事实证明我再也没有回去冲洗那些 RAW 图像。相对于 JPEG/HEIC（为简洁起见，我将其称为“拍摄 JPEG”，尽管自七年前的 iOS 11 以来iPhone 已默认使用更高效的 HEIC 格式），RAW 图像占用 10 ×（或更多）存储空间。

就是太麻烦了。对我来说，为了提高图像质量而勉强开发 RAW 所付出的努力是不值得的。对于许多严肃的摄影师来说，确实如此。每个人都有这样的一条线。有些人根本不做任何编辑。他们从不裁剪，从不改变后期曝光，从不应用滤镜——他们只是对准并拍摄就完成了。对我来说，这条线就是拍摄 RAW。

苹果三年前首次在 iPhone 13 中引入了摄影风格，有四种自我描述的主要风格：丰富对比度（我的选择）、活力、温暖和冷酷。每种主要风格都提供定制服务。找到您喜欢的风格，将其设置为默认风格，然后继续您的快乐之路。

在 iPhone 16 系列中，此功能现在明显更加强大，同时仍然方便易用。 5 Apple 消除了过去所谓的“过滤器”，并重新创建了更好的过滤器（例如“充满活力”和“戏剧性”）作为样式。现在有 15 种基本风格可供选择，其中大多数具有自我描述性名称（中性、金色、玫瑰金），还有一些更具诗意的名称（舒适、安静、空灵）。默认样式名为 Standard，它处理图像的方式看起来很像 iPhone 风格。到目前为止，让我着迷的两个是 Natural 和 Stark B&W。在我们许多人看来，标准 iPhone 图像处理长期以来看起来至少有些过度处理。太多的降噪，太多的平滑。有点太猛了。在我看来，自然确实看起来更自然，而且是一种好的方式。 Stark B&W 让人想起柯达 Tri-X等经典的高对比度黑白胶片。

现在摄影风格的一个关键方面是它们是非破坏性的。这根本不像应用过滤器并覆盖原始文件。您可以在帖子中改变主意。将默认设置为“斯塔克黑白”，稍后在“照片”中进行编辑时，您可以改变主意并使用您想要的任何其他样式返回全彩图像。 iPhone 16 硬件和 iOS 18 软件中都在幕后进行了大量复杂的图像处理，这让这看起来没什么大不了的。

我一直对自己懒得拍摄 RAW 感到有点内疚。我怀疑，iPhone 16 系列中的下一代摄影风格功能可能会减轻这种负罪感的残余痕迹。

我总是买黑色，或者最接近黑色的苹果产品，我在 2009 年写的这条推文仍然是正确的，所以这是我唯一有过“买哪种颜色？”的问题的一年。个人的困境是 2016 年iPhone 7 ，苹果提供了哑光“黑色”和类似维达的光泽“深黑色”两种颜色。 6我仍然有点不敢相信苹果在同一个型号年份提供了两种完全不同的黑色。

由于航海家一号的任务寿命非常长，它的部件在太阳系以外的寒冷外围地区老化，因此遇到了一些问题。当问题出现时，位于加利福尼亚州帕萨迪纳的美国宇航局喷气推进实验室的工程师必须发挥创造力，同时仍然要小心航天器对任何变化的反应。

目前距离地球最远的航天器航海者一号距离地球约 150 亿英里（240 亿公里）。该探测器在日光层之外运行——太阳的磁场和粒子气泡，远远超出冥王星轨道——在那里它的仪器直接对星际空间进行采样。

迈克尔·查邦 (Michael Chabon)，关于线程：

我发现航海者一号的持续使命如此感人，因为它的名字本身就让人想起一个充满希望的时代，因为想到这个小小的装置就在日光层边缘的广阔空间中——也许是最远的人造物体东西可能会永远旅行——有点破旧，迅速老化，但仍然在做它预定要做的工作。

五年前的一项令人惊叹的工程壮举，今天仍然是令人惊叹的工程壮举。

entry.summary: 主题演讲是反思整个苹果的代理。
entry.content:
苹果的“它是发光的”主题演讲之后的思想和观察

早在2007年7月，我将这张照片贡献给了一个名为“我们携带的物品”的Flickr小组：

17年后，我已经合并了。 2007年很久以前就没有创建现场笔记。现在，我的后装笔记本比那个精装的Moleskine更苗条。 1代替了莱瑟曼（Leatherman）和四个钥匙的戒指，我只能使用詹姆斯·布兰德（James Brand）的两个钥匙和一个哈利法克斯钥匙尺寸工具。钥匙和哈利法克斯平坦地放置在一条牛仔裤的更换袋中。 2尽管我确实拥有（非常喜欢）Ricoh Gr IIIX（这是上述相机的现代但非常相似的后代），但我并不是每天都会随身携带它，因为iPhone摄像机变得如此出色。

但是我从上面的照片中省略了每天的随身携带物品 - 有线耳塞。我不记得我是否省略了它们，因为我忘了包括它们，或者是出于美学原因。但是大约2007年，我通常和我一起有一双有线的苹果耳塞。今天，我一直拥有我的AirPods Pro - 远远不远我最喜欢的合并。按重量，AirPods（带有案例）较重，但通过烦恼来衡量，它们提供了有线耳塞体验的界限。

我的口袋中的其余物品是等效的，但已升级。我变得更好（因为我不再戴隐形眼镜，处方）太阳镜。我很久以前就从飞行员G2转到斑马萨拉萨（Zebra Sarasa） ，这是我认为几乎完美的笔。上面的瑞士军队手表在2009年初破裂，此后我开始了一小部分机械手表（我发誓）。但是在大多数工作日，我的手腕上都有一只苹果手表。

iPhone，Airpods，Apple Watch。我几乎总是随身携带两个，通常这三个。我敢肯定，你们中的许多人都读这本书，这总是三个。

这是苹果的三种“日常携带”产品。它们与我们的衣服，眼镜和珠宝一样是我们生活的一部分。因此，他们在同一产品介绍活动中游泳。

上周的“It's Glowtime”活动对苹果来说意义重大。自引入iPhone X以来，这可能是最强大的iPhone活动。这三个平台现在都处于出色，吸引人和连贯的形状上：

  • iPhone：对于非Pro iPhone 15型号而言，去年有点“ MEH”，该型号与一岁的A16硅粘在一起，并且没有获得新的硬件动作按钮。今年，iPhone 16和16 Plus获得了全新的A18芯片，动作按钮和新的相机控制按钮。今年，该相机控制按钮本年度本来是一项非常有意义的功能（对我而言，比去年更有意义，对我来说更有意义），但是所有新的iPhone都拥有它。今年的iPhone 16和16 Plus甚至在几年内就获得了最好，最有趣的颜色。 iPhone 16 Pro和16 Pro Max具有一流的相机系统，A18 Pro芯片（常规A18中的6 gpus vs.5，更大的CPU粘贴，更快的内存和存储I/O）以及稍大的屏幕。 3 iPhone仍然是世界上最重要，最有利可图的设备类别中最好的产品。

  • Apple Watch：新型Series 10型号具有更大的显示屏，较长的电池寿命以及厚度和重量的减少10％。新的手表显示稍大一些，更重要的是，观看角度也明显较大，并且在始终在模式模式下每秒更新一次，而不是每分钟一次。铝中有一个绝对华丽的抛光喷气式黑色选项 - 在整个Apple Watch历史上，标记了我的口味，这是一个基本价格的铝制型号，它可以与更昂贵的型号脚趾踩在美学上。但是那些更昂贵的型号也比以往任何时候都更好，苹果用更轻的抛光钛代替了抛光的不锈钢。我没有意识到可以将钛可以抛光到镜子般的光泽。苹果以前曾在钛中制作了Apple Watch系列模型 - 我在第5系列中购买了一款，并在系列7中再次购买了一款，但这些型号在版本中，价格在不锈钢模型上方。没有Ultra 3的公告 - 手表部分中的孤独音符 - 但Ultra 2现在有出色且肯定是宽大的缎面黑色DLC涂层。

  • AirPods：不再以入门级价格销售了多年的型号。新的好/更好/最好的阵容很清楚。好：新的Airpods 4，价格为129美元。更好的是： AirPods 4具有积极的噪声取消（ANC）和更好的案例（无线充电并找到我的支持，包括扬声器），价格为179美元。最佳：现有的249美元AirPods Pro，是的， 两年前首次亮相，但通过固件更新进行了改进的功能，最重要的是，现在，重要的是，现在认证的支持用作助听器。还有修订后的AirPods Max，具有新的颜色和USB-C替换闪电，但是可惜，现在所有其他AirPod型号中都没有可用的内部更新，例如H2芯片，这些型号的供款具有诸如语音隔离和点头/摇动 - 您的速度/摇式芯片。 Siri互动或无损音频支持。这是一个稍微酸的音符，但总的来说，AirPods阵容看起来（和声音）比以往任何时候都更好。

但是，尽管如此，星期二从加利福尼亚飞行回家，我被认为是恩努伊的一种感觉。在线程上，我用一个简短的句子总结了我的感受：

显而易见的事实是，我们所有人，包括苹果，史蒂夫·乔布斯小姐。

沃尔特·莫斯伯格（Walt Mossberg）引用我的话：

这个。绝对正确。 Steve后的工作苹果是一台惊人的赚钱机器，并且在Airpods和Apple Watch等产品中取得了一些显着的产品成功。但这并没有复制工作时代的大型游戏改变者产品体验。

在本周剩余的时间里，我一直在思考这个问题。一个因素是iPhone定义了个人计算的顶点。在PC的早期，每个人都知道我们想要可移植性。我们大多数人（包括我）都认为我们使用笔记本电脑到达了。但是，笔记本电脑并不是到处都与我们一起使用，事实证明，我们希望与我们一起使用的计算机。那就是iPhone，2007年的原始iPhone建立了全触摸屏的形式和一般概念。史蒂夫·乔布斯（Steve Jobs）向我们展示它的那一刻，第一个iPhone就震惊了我们。

最终，一些公司将再次引入这样的产品。可能是苹果。如果很快或很快发生任何时间，那可能是苹果。作为一家公司，苹果公司拥有一项长期战略，希望它将使它成为苹果的可能性。但是，由于iPhone以来，没有这样的产品，我认为，今天没有技术可以实现这种产品。我有信心的是，如果史蒂夫·乔布斯（Steve Jobs）还活着并且仍然领导苹果产品开发，那么在随后的几年中，不会像iPhone般的头脑震撼人心的新产品。

莫斯伯格（Mossberg）正确地引用了Airpods和Apple Watch是后Jobs时代的巨大成功。并非偶然，它们是上周活动中苹果的三个平台中的两个，也是人们携带的三个平台。但是我们并没有真正携带Airpods和Apple Watch - 我们戴上它们。它们并不比我们的iPhone重要，但是它们更亲密，更个人化。

但是它们也更加微妙。当Airpods首次亮相时，许多人以为他们看起来很奇怪。当Apple Watch首次亮相时，人们不知所措。但是事实证明，可能比iPhone更重要的是，苹果将两种产品都钉在了大门口。 Apple Watch具有标志性的，可以立即可识别的外形，但是从几英尺远的距离距离，很难从2015年的原始“系列0”型号中讲出崭新的系列10。原始手表带与最新型号（包括Ultras）保持兼容。使用AirPods，这些茎变得明显短，但总的来说，它们与2016年的原始模型完全相同。它们甚至以完全相同的颜色提供：白色，白色或白色。

我们看到的是蒂姆·库克的苹果。库克是一位强大的鼠尾草领导者，证据表明整个公司现在都在他的形象中越来越多。那是不可避免的。也不要说苹果会更糟。在某些方面是，但在其他方面，苹果会好得多。当然，我无法证明这一点，但我的直觉告诉我，今天史蒂夫·乔布斯领导的苹果公司在财务上的成功和行业主导地位将明显不如蒂姆·库克领导的苹果公司。

我认为，在Jobs下，Apple Watch将更像iPod或AirPods：一种完全由Apple定义的产品，而不是第三方开发人员的平台。 （乔布斯甚至不愿使iPhone成为平台。）

但最大的区别是，乔布斯领导下的苹果很古怪，而且我认为，与库克领导下的苹果相比，苹果仍会更加古怪。我想说，如果你认为库克耗尽了苹果的乐趣，那你就错了。但我确实认为他已经消除了怪癖。库克领导的苹果承担的风险太少。乔布斯的苹果承担了太多的风险。

蒂姆·库克不仅仅是精算师。远非如此。他与乔布斯（Jobs）分享了改变世界的雄心勃勃。库克（Cook）就像工作一样，肯定与沃尔特·迪斯尼（Walt Disney）的这一讽刺有关：“我们不会拍电影来赚钱。我们赚钱来制作更多电影。”但是，库克以改变世界的方式是不同的。

乔布斯经常在衬衫袖子上戴着自己的心，而不仅在公共场合，而且在舞台上。请记住2010年WWDC主题演讲时，由于Wi-Fi不起作用，乔布斯（Jobs现场博客主题演讲？他他妈的生气，他让我们知道。您根本没有弄乱史蒂夫·乔布斯（Steve Jobs）主题演讲。

库克几乎从来没有在公开场合揭示他真正的热情自我。但是至少他做了一次。在2014年的年度股东大会上，库克面临着右翼国家公共政策研究中心（NCPPR）代表的问题。正如Bryan Chaffin在MAC观察者的报道：

然而，在问答环节中，NCPPR代表问了库克先生的两个问题，这两者都符合该小组提议中所提出的原则。第一个问题挑战了库克先生的主张，即苹果的可持续发展计划和目标 - 苹果公司拥有100％的权力来自绿色来源 - 对底线有益。

代表们问库克先生是否仅仅是因为政府对绿色能源的补贴。库克先生并没有直接回答这个问题，而是专注于第二个问题：NCPPR代表要求库克先生在那时和那里只做那些有利可图的事情。

随之而来的是我唯一能记得看到蒂姆·库克（Tim Cook）生气的唯一一次，他明确地拒绝了NCPPR倡导背后的世界观。他说，苹果公司这样做很多事情，因为它们是正确的，公正的，而且投资回报率（ROI）并不是此类问题的主要考虑因素。

他说：“当我们努力使设备可通过盲人访问时，我不认为流血的投资回报率。”他对环境问题，工人安全以及苹果公司是领导者的其他领域说了同样的话。

正如他在他的回应中使用“血腥”的证明，这是我从库克先生那里见过的最接近的公众亵渎 - 很明显他很生气。他的肢体语言改变了，他的脸收缩了，与他说的通常的计量和控制方式相比，他用快速的火刑句子讲话。

但是，他并没有止步于此，因为他直接看着NCPPR代表说：“如果您只想出于投资回报率而做事，那么您应该摆脱此股票。”

麦肯锡味的怯ward，而不是领导才是“最适合投资回报率”的哲学。有时，领导者需要以不确定的业务意义做出决策，甚至知道该决定没有商业意义，而仅仅是因为他们的直觉或良心告诉他们这是正确的事情。就他愿意做出这样的决定而言，库克就像工作一样。但是，这些决定是什么样的，是非常不同的。

乔布斯致力于改进计算机的工作方式。库克致力于改善人类的生活方式。可访问性和环境的优先事项要比工作中的优先事项要高得多。苹果对健康的全部企业已经发生在库克的领导下，与健康相关的功能是上周的主题演讲中的触角功能。如果要获得AirPods Pro认证为医学级助听器的资金要比Apple从销售增加中赚取利润，我不会感到惊讶。苹果2030倡议将公司的整个碳足迹纳入净零排放量从根本上讲是关于做正确的事情，而不仅仅是出售更多产品。

乔布斯强调制造更多有趣的产品，并最大程度地发挥惊喜和喜悦。蒂姆·库克（Tim Cook） 在Gizmodo的紫色iPhone 4原型后不会派遣警察。史蒂夫·乔布斯（Steve Jobs）可能认为苹果对他们很容易。

烹饪值可预测性。但是可预测性与古怪相抵触。您甚至不需要意识到马克·古尔曼（Mark Gurman）的名字就可以预测上周的活动将重点放在新的iPhone，新的Airpods和New Apple Watch上。您也不需要遵循谣言磨坊才能正确猜测所有这些新产品看起来都与之前的型号非常相似。进化，进化，进化。苹果内部的桂冠没有任何产品。 iPhone 16，Apple Watch系列10和AirPods 4都是专注于行业领先的工程（包括在材料工程等领域）和设计的结果。但是它们也基本上看起来完全像我们所有人期望他们看起来一样。

还记得2007年的第三代iPod Nano吗？又名“胖纳米”：

您很可能不记得胖胖的 Nano，因为它并不是非常出色，尽管它取代了第二代 iPod Nano 型号。于是一年后，随着第四代 Nano 的推出，苹果又回到了又高又瘦的设计，就好像胖 Nano 从未出现过一样。

那个胖纳米很古怪。事后看来，这显然也是一个错误。我非常确定，苹果内部的设计师和产品人员在产品发布之前就认为这是一个错误。不管怎样，史蒂夫·乔布斯还是发货了，当然是因为他的直觉告诉他这是值得尝试的正确做法。蒂姆·库克领导的苹果不会犯这样的错误。这就是为什么库克的苹果公司更成功的原因 - 拥有更多的客户，更多的收入，更高的利润率（从而获得更多的利润），以及更多的，纯粹的主导地位（因此，更加监管的审查）。但这也是为什么库克的苹果会带来更少的惊喜。喜悦依然存在，但惊奇却少了。这是设计使然。他们没有尝试但未能达到乔布斯时代令人欣喜若狂的设计新颖的高度，因为那些高峰伴随着山谷。今天的苹果公司致力于并实现始终如一的卓越。古怪不再适合。

灯罩iMac G4 。 G4立方体。像Isight摄像头这样的外围设备 - 一种从未打算出售的产品，但属于Dieter Rams Braun的最佳设计，属于博物馆。花力量和达尔马提亚imacs 。在乔布斯（Jobs）下，苹果公司生产了许多令人难忘的产品，或者至少是其他所有修订的一代。但是有时候 - 就像胖纳米一样 - 他们是傻瓜。在库克下，苹果会立即产生标志性的设计，这些设计往往只能发展 - 在大多数可预测的时间表上都是可预测的。 4

蒂姆·库克（Tim Cook）的苹果（Apple）并没有错过任何基本的新技术或转变，这将导致改变行业的新产品或平台，如果他活着，史蒂夫·乔布斯（Steve Jobs）将导致苹果通过他的奇异天才或意志的纯粹力量创造。但是我也认为我们不会留下新的iPhone 16，看起来像去年的iPhone 15，看起来像iPhone 14，看起来像iPhone 13，看起来像iPhone 12 iPhone 11除了那一年的侧轨从圆形到平面，例如iPhone 4和5型号。我可以向您展示iPhone 4，您会立即知道它是iPhone 4或4s。我可以向您展示iPhone 5，您会知道这是iPhone 5或5s（或第一个iPhone SE ）。如果是黑色和板块iPhone 5，您甚至可能知道它是5个，而不是5s，因为黑色iPhone 5的阳极氧化随着时间的流逝而逐渐消失，产生了风化的外观 - 铜绿 - 我发现它很可爱令人回味的方式没有随后的iPhone。这是不完美的，但有时不完美是我们最喜欢产品的东西。 5从2020 - 2024年开始，我将不得不确切记住何时知道哪个是哪个iPhone。

库克有耐心的工作会变得不安。在工作时代，当主题演讲结束时，我们有时会互相转向彼此说：“你能相信____吗？”在上周的主题演讲之后，没有人要求这样做。苹果宣布的大部分内容令人印象深刻。很少令人失望。没有什么难以相信或令人惊讶的。

这对苹果或机构下降的迹象不利。 If anything, under Cook, Apple more consistently achieves near-perfection. Tolerances are tighter. Ship dates seldom slip. But it's a change that makes the company less fun to keenly observe and obsess over. Cook's Apple is not overly cautious, but it's never reckless. Jobs's Apple was occasionally reckless, for better and worse .

My dissatisfaction flying home from last week's event is, ultimately, selfish. I miss having my mind blown. I miss being utterly surprised. I miss occasionally being disappointed by a product design that stretched quirky all the way to wacky . I miss being amazed by something entirely unexpected out of left field. Poor me, stuck only with the announcement of noticeably improved versions of three products — three product families — that zillions of people around the world, myself included, carry with us wherever we go.

  1. Moleskine has long made thin, vaguely Field-Notes-y “ Cahier ” notebooks, but they suck. After just a few days in my back pocket, pages would start falling out. Field Notes aren't just fun; they are meant to be used and abused . ↩︎︎

  2. Also known as the iPod Nano pocket . ↩︎︎

  3. The overall devices are now, once again, slightly larger with the 16 Pro and Pro Max, too — which is not a positive for fans of smaller iPhones. iPhone 12/13 Mini holdouts, this footnote is for you. ↩︎︎

  4. I also believe that Apple would have gone back to live-on-stage keynotes, post-COVID, if Jobs were still around. The differences between those two keynote formats — live stage events vs. pre-filmed movies — are a good proxy for the changes to Apple as a whole. Apple's modern pre-filmed keynotes are better for the company and better for most people who want to watch them. (Viewership numbers, I am reliably told, are higher than ever — and today dwarf the viewership of Jobs-era keynotes.) They're far more interesting visually and more information-dense. (No need to wait for new presenters to walk on stage and then off again. Just cut to a new scene.) They're more expensive to produce but the results are 100 percent predictable. No Apple keynote demo will ever fail again. But they're also less exciting. Demo fails are fun (from the audience, not from the stage) and — as noted above, w/r/t the Wi-Fi at WWDC 2010 — memorable. And the possibility that any live demo might fail adds a degree of palpable tension to every demo, even the ones that wind up going off without a hitch . It's like the difference between watching a live motorcycle stunt show and a Fast and Furious movie. The movie looks better, but carries no sense of actual danger. ↩︎︎

  5. 或人。 ↩︎︎

entry.title: OpenAI Releases New o1 Reasoning Model
entry.content:
Kylie Robison, reporting for The Verge:

OpenAI is releasing a new model called o1, the first in a planned series of “reasoning” models that have been trained to answer more complex questions, faster than a human can. It's being released alongside o1-mini, a smaller, cheaper version. And yes, if you're steeped in AI rumors: this is, in fact, the extremely hyped Strawberry model.

For OpenAI, o1 represents a step toward its broader goal of human-like artificial intelligence. More practically, it does a better job at writing code and solving multistep problems than previous models. But it's also more expensive and slower to use than GPT-4o. OpenAI is calling this release of o1 a “preview” to emphasize how nascent it is. [...]

“The model is definitely better at solving the AP math test than I am, and I was a math minor in college,” OpenAI's chief research officer, Bob McGrew, tells me. He says OpenAI also tested o1 against a qualifying exam for the International Mathematics Olympiad, and while GPT-4o only correctly solved only 13 percent of problems, o1 scored 83 percent.

Putting aside the politics and other legitimate social and legal concerns around AI, scoring that well in a difficult math exam is just incredible.

Update: Robison wrote:

I wasn't able to demo o1 myself, but McGrew and Tworek showed it to me over a video call this week. They asked it to solve this puzzle:

“A princess is as old as the prince will be when the princess is twice as old as the prince was when the princess's age was half the sum of their present age. What is the age of prince and princess? Provide all solutions to that question.”

The model buffered for 30 seconds and then delivered a correct answer.

I found this puzzle pretty damn tricky, personally. I pasted it, verbatim, into ChatGPT-4o and it solved it, correctly, the first time. I pasted it into the new o1-Preview model, and it both took longer and gave me the incorrect answer. I replied to o1-Preview, “Are you sure about that answer? Can you try it again?” and this time it gave me the correct answer. Still impressive, but kind of weird that this was OpenAI's own example puzzle intended to show off the new o1-Preview model.

Spoilers follow. Avert your eyes from the remainder of the post if you want to solve this one your own. Here's how I solved the puzzle, with pen and paper, before pasting the puzzle into any LLMs:

设y = 公主现在的年龄， x = 王子的年龄。 Let d = the delta between princess and prince's ages. By definition, at any given year in time, d = y - x and therefore y = x + d . (To be pedantic, d equals the absolute value of y - x but somehow it's obvious to me, from phrase “as the prince will be”, that the princess is older than the prince.)

We care about three years:

  1. 现在。
  2. 当公主是从第 (1) 年开始年龄总和的一半时。
  3. When the princess is twice the prince's age from year (2).

For (1), we know by definition that this is always true now matter what year it is: y = x + d — that is to say the princess is d years older than the prince.

For (2) we can express the princess's age as:

 (y + x) / 2

And we from (1) we know that no matter what year it is, the prince is d years younger than the princess. So during year of (2), the prince's age can be expressed as:

 ((y + x) / 2) - d

and year (3) is defined as when the princess ( y ) is twice the above (the prince's age from year (2)), so the princess age in year (3) can be expressed as:

 2((y + x) / 2) - 2d

And in any given year, the prince's age is the princess's minus d , which can thus be expressed, for year (3), by subtracting one more d from the line above:

 2((y + x) / 2) - 3d

Cancelling out those 2's:

 y + x - 3d

That is the prince's age for year (3). The puzzle's definition is that princess's age now ( y ) is the same as prince's in year (3), the line above. So we can form an equation:

 y = y + x - 3d

Those y 's cancel out, so we are left with:

 x = 3d

And by definition y is always x + d (the prince's age plus their age difference), so:

 y = 4d

So for any given difference ( d ) in their ages, the prince must be 3 times d and the princess 4 times d :

不同之处Princess = 4d Prince = 3d
1 4 3
2 8 6
3 12 9
4 16 12
……

So a generalized solution are any ages where the princess is 4/3 the age of the prince. I double-checked this mentally by applying all the clauses of the puzzle to the princess and prince's ages in each line of the table above.

That's my answer and my thinking. Here's a link to my ChatGPT transcript . It's all one chat, with my first pasting of the puzzle sent to GPT-4o, and all my subsequent comments (including the second pasting of the puzzle) being sent to o1-Preview.

★

entry.title: FDA Grants Approval to AirPods Pro 2 for Use as Hearing Aids
entry.content:
Brian Heater, reporting for TechCrunch:

The iPhone 16 took center stage at Apple's “It's Glowtime” event, but the most interesting tidbit came from a different line entirely. Indeed, among a sea of new hardware came an intriguing software update to one already on the market: the AirPods Pro 2.

Apple announced that its most premium earbuds would double as an over-the-counter hearing aid, courtesy of a software update, pending approval from the US Food and Drug Administration.

The FDA on Thursday announced that it has granted what it calls “the first over-the-counter (OTC) hearing aid software device, Hearing Aid Feature.” Specifically, it has approved the software update that enables that functionality.

In briefings on Monday, Apple employees expressed what I can only describe as confidence that FDA approval for this would be imminent, but like sports fans, it was almost as though they didn't want to jinx it. Asked if FDA approval might come before the iOS 18.0 and MacOS 15.0 updates scheduled for this coming Monday, they wouldn't really answer, but had looks on their faces that said that's what we're hoping .

What a great feature this seems to be.

entry.title: Taylor Swift Endorses Kamala Harris, Encourages Followers to Register to Vote
entry.content:
Taylor Swift, in a post late last night on Instagram:

I've done my research, and I've made my choice.您的研究完全由您来做，选择也由您做出。我还想说，特别是对第一次投票的人：请记住，为了投票，您必须注册！我还发现提前投票要容易得多。 I'll link where to register and find early voting dates and info in my story.

With love and hope,

泰勒·斯威夫特
Childless Cat Lady

Given her almost unfathomable popularity, any endorsement is a big deal, period. But this was a really well-written statement. The emphasis on doing your own research about both candidates and making up your own mind is persuasive. For one, it appeals to anyone young who's leaning Trump but feeling squishy about it, and fancies themself an independent thinker. And it deflates any notion that she's telling her fans to vote for Kamala Harris just because she is.

Timing this endorsement for after the end of last night's debate seems strategic too. If Harris had done poorly, it would have presented a course-correcting narrative. Or, as actually happened, if Harris handed Trump his dumb red hat, it would run up the score.

And signing off that way? Chef's kiss .

Social media nerd note: Swift posted this to Instagram, and Instagram only . In 2020, when endorsing Joe Biden, she posted both to Instagram and Twitter . She has a Threads account but has only posted there three times, all back in April, upon the release of her album The Tortured Poets Department .

When the EU enacted GDPR in 2018, executives and security professionals waited anxiously to see how the law would be enforced. And then they kept waiting ... and waiting ... but the Great European Privacy Crackdown never came.

But the days of betting that you're too big or too small to be noticed by GDPR are over. Recently, EU member nations (plus the UK) have started taking action against data controllers of all sizes–from the big (Amazon), to the medium (a trucking company), to the truly minuscule (a Spanish citizen whose home security cameras bothered their neighbors).

If you're an IT or security professional, you may be wondering what to do. Unfortunately, GDPR compliance isn't the kind of thing you can solve by buying a tool or scheduling a training session. The best place to start is to adopt a policy of data minimization: collect only the data you truly need to function, on both customers and employees. After that, your second priority should be securing the data you have — keeping it only as long as you absolutely need to, and then destroying it.

1Password can help with all aspects of GDPR compliance. To learn more about GDPR compliance, check out this post at 1Password's blog .

★

entry.content:
There's a scene in Martin Scorsese's Casino . Gangster Nicky Santoro (Joe Pesci) and two of his goon friends are in a nightclub in the Tangiers casino resort (a fictionalized version of the old Stardust), which is run by Ace Rothstein (Robert De Niro). Santoro and Rothstein, who'd been friends for decades, are now on the outs. The Tangiers is a front for the mafia and the Teamsters. Rothstein, a gambling genius who was born to run a casino, is earning major bank for the bosses back home. Santoro is gangstering up Las Vegas, and is under severe law enforcement scrutiny. They just held a contentious meeting, just the two of them, at Santoro's request, in the middle of the desert — a meeting Rothstein wasn't sure wouldn't conclude with him dead in a freshly dug hole in the sand.

Santoro and his two friends are just a threesome.都是男人。 Morose.

Rothstein comes in with Billy Sherbert (Don Rickles) and a party of half a dozen or so men and women, including Oscar Goodman, famed defense attorney and future mayor of Las Vegas (playing himself), and several women. Everyone (but Rothstein, who's not much for fun) is laughing. You'd be laughing too if you were out having drinks with Don Fucking Rickles and Oscar Goodman.

Santoro gripes about Rothstein not acknowledging him, and, well, makes some comments that suggest he doesn't hold Jews in the highest esteem. Santoro's right-hand man, Frank Marino (played by the great Frank Vincent, of Billy “Go Get Your Fucking Shine Box” Batts fame), dryly observes, “They're having a good time, too.”

The camera pulls back to show their threesome, alone in their booth, isolated. Santoro, who is absolutely not having a good time, replies, “So are we.”

I've been thinking about that scene a lot, lately.

Allison Johnson, in a piece for The Verge headlined “ European iPhones Are More Fun Now ”:

Whining about stuff is a treasured American pastime, so allow me to indulge: the iPhone is more fun in Europe now, and it's not fair.

They're getting all kinds of stuff because they have cool regulators, not, like, regular regulators. Third-party app stores , the ability for browsers to run their own engines , Fortnite , and now the ability toreplace lots of default apps ? I want it, too! Imagine if Chrome on iOS wasn't just a rinky dink little Safari emulator!

Imagine if Chrome could deplete your iPhone battery as fast as it does your MacBook battery. Imagine if you were one of the millions (zillions?) of people whose “incognito mode” browsing history was observed and stored by Google and deletedonly after they lost a lawsuit . Imagine — and this takes a lot of imagination — if Google actually shipped a version of Chrome for iOS, only for the EU, that used its own battery-eating rendering engine instead of using the energy-efficient system version of WebKit.

Imagine downloading a new dialer app with a soundboard of fart sounds and setting it as your default! Unfortunately, Apple doesn't seem interested in sharing these possibilities with everyone.

听起来很有趣。

Sure, we've got retro game emulators in the app store . And that rules. But that's only because Apple was worried everyone in the EU was about to download AltStore PAL so they could play Ocarina of Time on their iPhones.

If the benefit of the DMA is allowing emulators worldwide how is that an advantage for people in the EU?

Here's the thing: wouldn't it just be good business to offer everyone the same choices no matter where they live? It's not as if Apple was making two different iPhones to try to appeal to different cultural preferences. It's making one iPhone that's more flexible and customizable and one that isn't.

Maybe, bit by bit, Apple will cave in and offer parity the way it did with emulators. But I think the company should make an uncharacteristic move: drop the charade and let everyone, everywhere have the same iPhone. It would be bold! Courageous, even! But most importantly, it would be a lot more fun.

Yes, let's allow everyone, around the world, to delete their Camera app .听起来很有趣。

Federico Viticci, on Threads :

My realization in 2024 has been that the DMA fork of iOS is the best iPhone experience. We can finally use our phones like actual computers with more default apps and apps from external sources.

And on MacStories :

It's still iOS, with the tasteful design, vibrant app ecosystem, high-performance animations, and accessibility we've come to expect from Apple; at the same time, it's a more flexible and fun version of iOS predicated upon the assumption that users deserve options to control more aspects of how their expensive pocket computers should work. Or, as I put it : some of the flexibility of Android, but on iOS, sounds like a dream to me.

Apparently, this thought — that people who demand options should have them — really annoys a lot of (generally American) pundits who seemingly consider the European Commission a draconian entity that demands changes out of spite for a particular corporation, rather than a group of elected officials who regulate based on what they believe is best for their constituents and the European market.

Let's run a tally. On the EU side, there is Fortnite and other games from Epic, a shady company that was justifiably booted from the App Store for bait-and-switch chicanery intended to provoke a lawsuit in which they got their asses handed back to them . On the rest-of-the-world side we have the imminent release of iPhone Mirroring and Apple Intelligence. I don't play Fortnite, and even if I did, I wouldn't on my phone, but I find the latter far more interesting — and fun — than the former.

The non-Epic iOS software available exclusively in the EU is ... well, nothing of interest. Maybe some apps that help with content piracy.除此之外，什么都没有。 Admittedly, the DMA only went into effect 6 months ago. Long-term, maybe there will arise a thriving ecosystem of useful and fun apps and games that are exclusively available in EU marketplaces. Right now, it's Fortnite. There are a bunch of articles (and surely soon to be more) informing EU citizens how to access Apple Intelligence (by lying about where they are). There are crickets chirping regarding how iOS users outside the EU can cheat their way into the EU's new DMA rules.没有人关心。

Meanwhile no one in the EU will get Apple Intelligence or iPhone Mirroring, both of which features are very useful, and, dare I say, quite fun. Should we judge how much fun each side of the continental divide is having by how much fun they theoretically could be having, or by how much fun they are having?

As it stands, the fun side is not the EU. But hope springs eternal.

;
entry.title: ★ The iOS Continental Drift Fun Gap
More on Spotify Connect and iPhone Volume Buttons
entry.content:
Emma Roth, reporting for The Verge last week:

Spotify users on iPhone will no longer be able to control the volume on connected devices using their physical volume buttons. In an update to its support page , Spotify said Apple “discontinued” this technology, forcing iPhone owners to use an annoying workaround. [...]

“We've made requests to Apple to introduce a similar solution to what they offer users on HomePod and Apple TV for app developers who control non-Apple media devices,” Spotify says in its update. “Apple has told us that they require apps to integrate into Home Pod in order to access the technology that controls volume on iPhones.”

I believe Spotify has subsequently edited their support page, because the above text no longer appear here , where it now reads:

Apple has discontinued the technology that enables Spotify to control volume for connected devices using the volume buttons on the device. While we work with them on a solution, you can use the Spotify app to easily adjust the volume on your connected device.

It remains unclear to me exactly what is going on here. I think what happened is that what Spotify was doing to enable users to use the hardware volume buttons on their iPhones to control the volume of playback on other devices via Spotify Connect was making use of private or undocumented APIs, and Apple shut those APIs down in iOS 17.6. In short, that it was a hack that stopped working or just stopped working reliably.

But I was wrong yesterday to say — in the headline of the post , of all places — that Spotify could solve the problem by adopting AirPlay 2. Spotify Connect is, and needs to be, its own separate thing. Spotify users who use Connect love it. Here's what one DF reader wrote to me: “AirPlay is a per-device feature, while Spotify Connect synchronizes Spotify sessions across devices. I can initiate playing on my iPhone, then control it from my iPad, Mac, or Watch. I can change the destination speaker from any device. It's so good that I'm forever wedded to Spotify until Apple or someone else comes up with an equivalent experience. I think if AirPlay offered equivalent functionality, but Spotify refused to adopt it, Spotify would be open to more criticism, but from the perspective of a Spotify user, it's lost functionality and even supporting AirPlay 2 would not fix what is now a diminished experience. So I think Spotify is doing the only thing they can, which is complain.”

The basic gist is that Apple has always controlled the hardware buttons and switches on iOS devices. Games can't use the volume buttons as, say, left/right or up/down buttons. In the very early years of the App Store third-party camera apps started using the volume buttons as camera shutter buttons, but Apple then forbade it — and then started using those buttons as shutter buttons in the system Camera app, and then, like 15 years later, finally added an API for this use case in iOS 17.2 .

But note that new API is only for using these buttons for capture:

Important You can only use this API for capture use cases. The system sends capture events only to apps that actively use the camera. Backgrounded capture apps, and apps not performing capture, don't receive events.

Spotify (and Sonos) were clearly using the hardware volume buttons in ways unapproved. It's fair to argue that Apple should provide APIs they can use, especially if it's for controlling audio volume, even if on another device.但他们没有。

Also worth noting: when using Apple's own Remote app to control an Apple TV, the iPhone hardware volume buttons adjust the volume on the Apple TV. According to Apple this also works when using the Remote app to control an AirPlay-compatible smart TV. That's the ability Spotify and Sonos seek for themselves.

See also: Michael Tsai .

Update: I think Marco Arment nailed it :

My guess is this API, which has been deprecated for a decade:
developer.apple.com/documentation/[...]/mpmusicplayercontroller/

It's the only way we've ever been able to programmatically set the iPhone volume, so it's how apps would intercept volume buttons: observe it for changes, and upon a change, immediately set it back, then perform the custom action.

The only other known method is subview-diving on the MPVolumeView, but I don't think that was ever reliable enough to actually write changes to the volume.

In other words, it wasn't just a hack that stopped working, it was a pretty filthy hack that stopped working. There has never been an API for third-party apps to use the hardware volume buttons to do what Spotify Connect and Sonos were doing.应该有。 But there never was, and still isn't.

★
;

entry.content:
At the end of August, Apple announced several more DMA compliance changes . They are worth examining in detail.

Changes to the Mandatory Browser Choice Screen

Developers of browsers offered in the browser choice screen in the EU will have additional information about their browser shown to users who view the choice screen, and will get access to more data about the performance of the choice screen. The updated choice screen will be shown to all EU users who have Safari set as their default browser. For details about the changes coming to the browser choice screen, view About the Browser Choice Screen in the EU .

Some of the choice details of the new changes:

  • All users with Safari as their default browser, including users who have already seen the choice screen prior to the update, will see the choice screen upon first launch of Safari after installing the update available later this year.

  • The choice screen will not be displayed if a user already has a browser other than Safari set as default.

  • The choice screen will be shown once per device instead of once per user.

  • When migrating to a new device, if (and only if) the user's previously chosen default browser was Safari, the user will be required to reselect a default browser (ie unlike other settings in iOS, the user's choice of default browser will not be migrated if that choice was Safari).

I get that the entire point of this mandatory choice screen is that because iOS is, in DMA parlance, a designated “gatekeeping” platform, the presumption is that Apple has unfairly advantaged Safari by bundling it with the OS and making it the default. So, from the European Commission's perspective, some significant number of iOS users are using Safari only because it is bundled and default, and would prefer and/or be better served — or even just equally served — using another web browser as their default. Thus, Safari gets treated differently. It's not just another browser in a list of 11. It's the only browser whose users will be forced to choose again even if they've already chosen it in iOS 17.4 or later. It's the only browser whose users will be forced to choose again whenever they migrate to a new iPhone or iPad. What exactly is the point of forcing this screen per-device rather than per-user, other than to repeatedly irritate Safari users who own multiple iOS devices?

At what point do these restrictions punish Safari users who want to use Safari? I'd say the EC has crossed that point by forcing these rules on Apple. Another detail:

  • Users will be required to scroll through the full list of browser options before setting a browser as default.

You know how in certain “terms and conditions” agreement screens, you can only “agree” after scrolling all the way to the bottom of the legalese that almost no one actually reads? That's how the browser choice screen must now work. Almost nothing in iOS works like this, and I suspect more than a few users who spot their preferred browser above the fold in the randomized list will find it very confusing that after selecting their browser, “nothing happens”. This is legally-mandated bad interaction design.

If Safari is currently in the user's Dock or on the first page of the Home Screen and the user selects a browser that is not currently installed on their device from the choice screen, the selected browser will replace the Safari icon in the user's Dock or in the Home Screen.

For 17 years, the iOS Home Screen has been consistently spatial . Wherever an app is placed on your Home Screen, it stays there. Now, obviously, the EC's objection is that Apple has unfairly privileged Safari with default placement in the user's Dock, and they are seeking to remove this privilege for any user who chooses a browser other than Safari on the choice screen. But surely some number of users will regret their choice. Or simply seek to open Safari while trying some other browser as their new default. But now, unlike the way iOS has worked for 17 years, the Safari icon won't be where they left it. It's also worth noting that apps in the iOS Dock don't show their names, only their icons. There surely exist many satisfied Safari users who don't even know what “Safari” is — they only know the blue-compass icon. And they know that whenever they open URLs from an email or text message, those URLs open in an interface with which they're completely familiar. The browser choice screen does, of course, show the browsers' icons, but still. This is legally-mandated confusion.

The list of browsers presented to users remains mostly unchanged from Apple's previous browser choice screen: the 11 most-downloaded browsers in each member state of the EU. So each of the 27 EU nations has its own list. Apple lists the current browsers, per country, at the bottom of their support page .

Here is a single list of all included browsers, sorted by how many of the 27 EU nations they're included in. For the 9 browsers included in all 27 countries, I've randomized the order:

  • Chrome, Google LLC (27)
  • Edge, Microsoft Corporation (27)
  • Opera, Opera Software AS (27)
  • 勇敢，勇敢的软件 (27)
  • 苹果 Safari (27)
  • DuckDuckGo、DuckDuckGo 公司 (27)
  • 阿罗哈，阿罗哈移动 (27)
  • 洋葱浏览器，迈克·蒂加斯 (27)
  • 火狐、Mozilla (27)
  • 你，SuSea Inc. (23)
  • 埃科西亚, 埃科西亚 (17)
  • 维瓦尔第、维瓦尔第技术 (13)
  • Web@Work、MobileIron (10)
  • 网络、AirWatch LLC (5)
  • 想要，Q想要 (3)
  • 浏览器，Maple Media Apps LLC (3)
  • Access，黑莓公司 (3)
  • Seznam.cz、Seznam.cz 为 (2)
  • Presearch，Presearch.org 全球有限公司 (1)
  • Avast 安全浏览器、AVAST 软件 (1)

我熟悉所有 27 个国家/地区的 9 种浏览器中的大多数，您可能也熟悉。但我从未听说过Aloha或Onion Browser ，尤其是 Onion Browser 来自个人开发者 Mike Tigas。 （ Onion 浏览器也因开源而脱颖而出。）Aloha 和 Onion 都被宣传为“注重隐私”，对于连接到Tor的 Onion 浏览器来说尤其如此。 Aloha 包括内置广告拦截和跳过地理围栏的 VPN。

因此，11 个位置中的 9 个被整个欧盟的相同流行浏览器占据。在其他 11 种浏览器中，我唯一听说过的是Ecosia ，它与 DuckDuckGo 一样，作为搜索引擎而广为人知（并且与 DuckDuckGo 一样，它位于 Safari 在大多数国家/地区提供的非常短的搜索引擎列表中世界各地）。 1

您是否知道BlackBerry 开发了一款 iOS 浏览器，并且它在爱尔兰、波兰和瑞典非常受欢迎？我没有。 （你知道黑莓仍然存在吗？我不知道。）

这个强制浏览器选择屏幕的全部目的是为了吸引 Safari 用户并让他们尽可能轻松地切换默认浏览器。但这样的用户有多少，谁应该切换？有多少用户了解什么是网络浏览器、什么是默认网络浏览器，目前默认使用 Safari，但看到这个选择屏幕并想“哦，这太棒了，我不知道我可以切换到一个对于这些其他浏览器，我会这样做...... ”？我确信存在一些这样的用户。但我也确信还有其他用户不太了解网络浏览器是什么，不知道他们当前使用的浏览器（也许已经使用了十多年）被命名为“Safari” ，并且不知道如何撤消他们在此浏览器选择屏幕上可能犯的错误。 Users who already know how to change their default iOS web browser don't need this mandatory choice screen;不知道如何更改默认浏览器的用户可能会陷入错误或后悔的选择。选择Safari，您将再次看到此浏览器选择屏幕； pick anything else, perhaps as a lark, and you'll never see it again.

我的猜测是，也许与直觉相反，这个强制浏览器选择屏幕的最大受益者将是谷歌浏览器，我认为它是当今世界上最具主导地位的软件垄断者。已经知道自己想要使用非 Safari 浏览器并将其设置为默认浏览器的用户甚至不会看到此屏幕。想要使用 Safari 并且知道自己想要使用 Safari 的用户只会被这个屏幕（反复）惹恼。但对这个屏幕感到困惑的非技术用户（我保证仅在欧盟就有数百万这样的用户）肯定会选择他们听说过的浏览器，并希望他们做出了正确的选择。 Chrome 是迄今为止世界上使用最广泛的网络浏览器，对于某些用户来说，这是他们唯一听说过的浏览器。

iOS 17.4 在 3 月份发布后不久——这是第一个具有 DMA 合规功能的版本，也是第一个为欧盟 Safari 用户提供强制浏览器选择屏幕的版本——有一些关于第三方浏览器用户数量增加的报道。TechCrunch 的这篇文章也许是最好的例子。这些收益主要以贝索斯的数字来报告——相对收益，没有绝对数字。 Aloha 浏览器“表示 3 月份欧盟用户增长了 250%”。 Opera 报告称，“从 3 月 3 日到 4 月 4 日，iOS 上选择其浏览器作为默认浏览器的用户增长了 39%”——但这低于iOS 在欧盟实施强制选择屏幕之前的上个月 164% 的增长。报告实际数字的浏览器是 Brave：

“今年 3 月份，随着新的浏览器面板的推出，Brave 在欧盟 iOS 上的每日安装量从 7,500 左右增加到 11,000 左右，”公司发言人表示。 “在过去的几天里，我们的每日安装量创下了历史新高，达到 14,000 次，几乎是我们预选屏幕数量的两倍。”

自四月以来，我看到了有关小型浏览器的浏览器选择屏幕持续“成功”的消息。我想这在欧盟迫使苹果做出进一步让步的过程中发挥了一定作用——尤其是向所有已经在 iOS 17.4、17.5 或 17.6 中选择了 Safari 的欧盟 iOS 用户重新呈现浏览器选择屏幕。但我认为事实是显而易见的：绝大多数 iOS 用户使用 Safari 是因为他们想要这样做，从欣赏 Safari 功能、UI 和隐私的见多识广的书呆子，到只知道自己喜欢这种体验的非技术典型用户与苹果的第一方应用程序和服务生态系统。

但无论这个浏览器选择屏幕对欧盟 iOS 浏览器的使用有何影响，我都认为 Chrome 不会从中受益最多。对于旨在监管“大型看门人”的法律来说，这似乎是一个反常的结果。 Chrome在全球所有网络浏览市场中占据 65% 的市场份额，比 iOS、Android 或 Windows 具有更大的垄断地位，唯一拥有两位数市场份额 (19%) 的其他浏览器是 Safari——欧盟委员会正试图将这款浏览器steer users away from.

“默认”应用程序

回到苹果在其开发者新闻网站上的声明：

对于欧盟用户，iOS 18 和 iPadOS 18 还将在“设置”中包含一个新的“默认应用程序”部分，其中列出了每个用户可用的默认应用程序。在未来的软件更新中，用户将获得拨打电话号码、发送消息、翻译文本、导航、管理密码、键盘和垃圾电话过滤器的新默认设置。要了解更多信息，请查看在欧盟分发的应用程序的更新。

此外，欧盟用户现在可以删除 App Store、消息、照片、相机和 Safari 应用程序。

请记住，至少自 iOS 14（四年前）以来，我们已经能够从主屏幕中删除我们想要的任何应用程序。只是某些重要的系统应用程序无法删除- 从主屏幕中删除后，它们仍然可以在应用程序库中使用。应用程序库是 iOS 的一个重要补充，也许应该早几年出现。但欧盟委员会现在要求苹果公司能够删除这些应用程序。 This is particularly tricky with the App Store app, because it's through the App Store that one can reinstall deleted default iOS apps.据推测，App Store 应用程序将可以通过“设置”重新安装，这是仅有的两个不可删除的应用程序之一。 2

那些为这些变化欢呼雀跃的人忽略的是，删除这些核心系统应用程序并不能神奇地使 iOS 成为一个模块化系统。苹果尚未为欧盟的第三方应用程序发布任何类型的 API 来处理 SMS（现在是 RCS）蜂窝短信，我也不指望他们会这么做。这样的 API 将是隐私和安全的噩梦。 3我的猜测是，如果您尝试删除消息应用程序，iOS 会向您显示一个特殊的确认警报，警告您后果，如果您继续，您的 iPhone 将不再能够发送或接收 SMS 或 RCS 消息。显然，还有 iMessages。多么棒的功能啊。

同样，苹果还没有宣布任何类型的模块化照片存储 API。在撰写本文时，删除系统照片和相机应用程序的用户将无法选择其他应用程序来处理照片存储。 Photos and videos shot will still go to the system photo library.用户之前存储在设备上的图像仍将保留在系统照片库中。只是苹果不会有一个应用程序来显示系统照片库。我的理解是，在幕后，照片和相机都不是传统意义上的真正的“应用程序”。它们只是低级系统框架的薄包装。相同的系统级框架允许第三方应用程序访问系统照片库。 Apple, seemingly, hasn't been forced to allow third-party software to replace these low-level system frameworks.他们只是被迫允许用户“删除”这些将自己作为应用程序呈现给用户的薄包装程序。但系统照片库的实际工作方式保持不变。这就像如果 Mac 让你删除 Finder — 文件系统仍然存在，但用户将无法浏览它。

一个具有基本模块化设计的操作系统，以及允许几乎每个系统组件被第三方软件替换的 API，听起来是一个好主意。但实际上没有一个主要操作系统是这样构建的。 iOS当然不是。因此，要求苹果允许“删除”照片和相机等应用程序纯粹是轻易的，并且暴露了欧盟委员会的技术无知。发表这些言论的 EC 官员显然不知道 iOS 的实际工作原理。他们只知道他们能看到什么。 iOS 附带了很多应用程序。他们所关心的是，现在欧盟的用户将能够删除这些应用程序。

当然，许多摄影师更喜欢使用第三方相机应用程序而不是苹果的系统相机应用程序。但 iOS 长期以来一直为使用第三方相机应用程序提供了丰富的支持，并且在 iOS 18 中，这种支持变得更好，用户很快就能够配置以前仅用于启动系统相机应用程序的锁屏按钮。 （迄今为止专用于系统手电筒“应用程序”的按钮也是如此 - 也可以在 iOS 18 中配置。）添加到锁定屏幕的相机应用程序甚至在 iOS 18 中获得特殊权限- 对于全球所有用户，而不仅仅是在欧盟。即使是第三方相机应用程序的开发人员也认为删除系统相机应用程序没有任何意义。

那么谁会从能够彻底“删除”照片和相机应用程序中受益呢？据我所知，只有患有强迫症的人才会担心将它们从主屏幕中删除后，它们仍然列在应用程序库中。我不清楚欧盟用户是否能够删除照片和相机等应用程序，即使他们没有安装任何第三方摄影应用程序，这将使他们的 iPhone 处于无法获取新照片的状态。照片或查看现有照片。这是表演性监管。这些可删除的应用程序都不会增加竞争；它只会增加用户产生深刻困惑的可能性。

需要明确的是，就像浏览器选择屏幕一样，我认为苹果的这些“默认应用程序”和“可删除应用程序”合规性让步不会有多大影响。按照设计，在 iOS 中删除应用程序是一个多步骤的过程，甚至需要长时间按住才能进入抖动模式。即使是新手用户也不会意外删除应用程序。但用户确实没有可衡量的需求来删除必要的系统应用程序。那么要求苹果支持有什么意义呢？就为了看公司跳舞？

我的意思是为什么停在这里？为什么不要求 Apple 发货时仅预装“设置”和“电话”功能的新 iPhone？为什么不强制允许用户删除整个操作系统？

Apple Intelligence 和 iPhone 镜像

当苹果在 6 月份 WWDC 几周后宣布，今年最大的两个功能——Apple Intelligence 和 iPhone Mirroring——今年可能在欧盟仍然无法使用，“由于数字市场法案带来的监管不确定性” ，DMA支持者怀疑恶意是动机。我当时引用了伊恩·贝特里奇的话，并将再次引用他的话，因为我认为他的反应集中体现了这一观点：

那么，Apple，Apple Intelligence 违反了 DMA 的哪些部分？因为除非你能真正告诉我们——在这种情况下，我们显然对你所提出的有关其运作方式的一些说法存在一些问题——否则你就是在胡说八道，只是想在欧盟方面获得一些影响力。哪个是蒂姆？

我绝对保证人们会接受这样的说法：“好吧，多亏了 DMA，你无法让 Apple Intelligence 工作！！”没有真正询问任何关于它违反了什么的问题，因为“苹果说的是，他们不会撒谎”

我在 6 月份对 Betteridge 的回应是成立的，而且随着苹果公司的这些最新让步，我看起来更有先见之明。

由于 DMA 特别适用于 Apple，我认为 DMA 支持者的错误在于他们并不是真正的 DMA 支持者，而是 App Store 的反对者。他们强烈反对苹果对 iOS 上所有第三方软件的严格控制，包括（如果不是特别的话）对通过本机应用程序访问的应用程序、游戏和数字内容的支付的控制。因此他们认可并支持 DMA，因为 DMA 打破了这种控制。由于 DMA，欧盟现在存在 iOS 第三方应用程序市场，Apple 自己的 App Store 中的应用程序可以选择新条款来使用自己的支付处理（在欧盟）。因此，从苹果 App Store 反对者的角度来看，DMA 总体上一定是一个净利，因为他们认为 DMA 的意义（至少与苹果有关）是为了打破 App Store 对所有 iOS 的束缚。第三方原生软件。

但这根本不是 DMA 的重点。这只是它的副产品之一。这是一个非常引人注目的副产品，因为支持替代应用市场和替代支付处理是苹果从今年 3 月开始需要遵守的法规。如果您对 Apple 的个人不满是 App Store 模式，那么您很容易得出 DMA 旨在打破该模式的结论。如果您认为 DMA 主要是为了打破 App Store 模式，那么很容易看出您认为 Apple Intelligence 和 iPhone Mirroring 会引发任何合规性问题的说法是无稽之谈，因此向欧盟用户（以及第三个）保留这些功能功能、SharePlay 屏幕共享的增强）一定是苹果方面的恶意。

我认为，苹果公司向欧盟用户隐瞒这些功能是出于恶意，希望欧盟 iOS 用户反对 DMA，并以某种方式要求欧盟代表废除或修改该功能。但这很容易。苹果公司对 DMA 提出了反对意见，克雷格·费德里吉 (Craig Federighi) 于 2021 年在葡萄牙里斯本网络峰会上发表的主题演讲就是最好的例证，但无济于事。 DMA 在欧洲议会以压倒性优势获得通过：588 票赞成，11 票反对，31 票弃权。这是大陆的法律。

苹果出于恶意而向欧盟公民拒绝提供主要的 iOS 功能是没有意义的。即使你认为苹果公司的自身利益高于一切，但他们最大的自身利益就是销售新 iPhone。今年 iPhone 16 机型中最大的新功能将是 Apple Intelligence，而 iOS 18 中最好的新功能是 iPhone 屏幕共享。这些功能将有助于 iPhone 的销售，但至少今年不会在欧盟销售。

关键是DMA并不是针对App Store模式的针对性攻击。这是对整个集成理念的广泛攻击。整合是苹果的全部运作方式。硬件和软件的集成旨在协同工作。不同设备之间的集成——连续性——旨在协同工作。

另外：同一设备上不同应用程序之间的集成。 Safari 不仅仅是 Apple 的网络浏览器。它是 Apple 设计的 Web浏览器，用于在 iOS 上以iOS 方式（以及在 MacOS 上以Macintosh 方式）执行操作。如果作为用户，您按照 Apple 的方式做事 — 拥有多台 Apple 设备、使用 iCloud 进行同步、使用 Safari 作为网络浏览器 — 您将获得集成体验，可以在设备 A 上访问设备 B 上打开的选项卡、共享所有设备之间的浏览历史记录和书签，以及对系统范围服务和功能的支持。新出厂 iPhone 上的 Apple 默认应用程序旨在协同工作并一致地呈现自己。这并不是说任何人都不应该使用替代苹果应用程序的第三方应用程序。当然不是。当然，几乎每一位《大胆火球》的读者都使用一个或多个替代苹果应用程序的第三方应用程序。 I use several.但内置的苹果应用程序加在一起就构成了苹果定义的体验。这些确实是大多数非专家用户应该使用的应用程序。最好的第三方替代品——比如Fantastical （日历）、 Cardhop （通讯录）、 Overcast （播客）和Bear （笔记）——可以无缝融入 Apple 的整体体验。它们是感觉与第一方体验融为一体的第三方应用程序。

从 EC 的角度来看，一切都应该模块化和商品化。这就是他们对“竞争”的理想。在“手机”和“平板电脑”领域的主导地位不应让制造这些设备的公司在网络浏览器、电子邮件客户端、消息传递或相机应用程序市场上占据优势。 But from Apple's perspective, the iPhone isn't merely a “phone”, a piece of commoditized hardware.这就是为什么该公司通常避免发表文章，在谈论和撰写文章时不提及“iPhone”，而只提及“iPhone”。对于苹果来说，iPhone 是一种综合体验，包括硬件、软件和服务，全部由苹果自己设计和制造。

Now that we have proof that the DMA demands that Apple allow all apps other than Settings (and on iPhones, Phone) to be deleted, and to allow third-party defaults to be set for everything from contactless payments to password management to maps to translation and even keyboards (keyboards?), it's obvious that the EC might also demand that users be able to specify a third-party “default” AI language model for Apple Intelligence.不仅仅是苹果目前与 OpenAI 独家合作提供的可选“世界知识”层，还有具有语义个人知识的 Apple Intelligence 基础层。 Apple Intelligence 并不是这样设计的。它不是一个模块或一个“应用程序”。它是系统软件的深度集成层。面对欧盟委员会的决定，即苹果要么将所有 Apple Intelligence 向第三方 AI 开放（包括苹果本身未经审查的 AI 系统），要么永远不在欧盟提供 Apple Intelligence，我认为苹果会选择永远不在欧盟提供。欧盟。

至于 iPhone 屏幕共享，DMA 不允许网守平台优先选择网守本身的其他产品或服务。 iPhone 屏幕共享仅适用于 iPhone 和 Mac（Apple 制造的计算机）之间。这是违反 DMA 的——或者至少 EC 可以明确裁定它违反 DMA。

如果 DMA 于 10 年前生效，我认为 Apple Watch 不会在欧盟上市，除非欧盟委员会表示允许。 AirPods 也是如此，与标准蓝牙相比，它与 Apple 设备的配对方式要优越得多，但也是专有的。 iPhone 和其他 Apple 设备之间任何第三方设备无法使用的集成都可能被裁定违反 DMA。我认为，根据 DMA 的信函，EC应该裁定所有此类整合均属违规。

随着时间的推移，这种不确定性可能会消失。也许欧盟委员会会裁定 Apple Intelligence 和/或 iPhone 屏幕共享不违反 DMA，并且 Apple 可以在欧盟提供这些功能（就像它们目前存在的那样）。就像，也许 EC 委员本身真的只是想打破 App Store 模式，仅此而已。但欧盟委员会副主席玛格丽特·维斯塔格 (Margrethe Vestager) 明确认为，Apple Intelligence 具有反竞争性，因此违反了 DMA。她在 7 月份的欧洲论坛上发表讲话时表示：

我觉得很有趣的是，他们说我们现在将在没有义务促进竞争的地方部署人工智能。我认为这是最令人震惊的公开声明，他们 100% 知道这是在他们已经拥有据点的情况下阻碍竞争的另一种方式。

她非常明确地表示，她相信苹果公司“有义务在 DMA 下与人工智能展开竞争”。 Apple Intelligence 根本不存在竞争。这里必须付出一些东西。

欧盟委员会的明显期望是，由于欧盟规模如此之大，对世界如此重要，苹果公司——以及 DMA 的其他目标“看门人”——将屈服于其意愿，并从此在设计其产品和服务时考虑到 DMA。在堆栈的所有层，模块化胜于集成。欧盟内部市场专员蒂埃里·布雷顿 (Thierry Breton)在 7 月份打趣道：“苹果的新口号应该是‘与众不同’。”

但欧盟并没有那么大，也没有那么重要。欧盟委员会被自大妄想所困扰。 What's happening with Apple Intelligence and iPhone Screen Sharing this year is what I expect to happen with every new product or service Apple creates that integrates with iOS: they will come late, or never, to the EU. Apple 创造的所有新产品和服务都与 iOS 集成，因此 Apple 的几乎所有新产品都会迟到或永远不会出现在欧盟。

虽然这不是 DMA 的初衷，但这就是 DMA 的实际效果。

  1. DuckDuckGo 和 Ecosia 都是 Safari 中支持的搜索引擎的名称，而网络浏览器是 Safari 的独立替代品，这一事实肯定会让非技术用户感到困惑。我并不是说 DuckDuckGo 或 Ecosia 不应该制作自己的浏览器，或者应该以不同的方式命名它们，但想象一下，如果谷歌没有将他们的浏览器命名为“Chrome”，而是将其命名为“Google”，会产生怎样的混乱。 ↩︎

  2. 另一个剩余的不可删除的应用程序是电话，我认为不能删除它，以保持遵守法律，要求所有手机，无论是否有有效的 SIM 卡，都能够拨打紧急服务电话（例如，这里的 911）我们）。 ↩︎︎

  3. 还要注意的是，虽然 Android 始终提供 API 来允许第三方应用程序处理 SMS 蜂窝消息传递，但支持安全 E2EE 的流行消息传递应用程序却避开了它。 Signal 在 Android 上支持短信已有 10 多年，但在 2022 年宣布将取消短信支持，原因很充分，他们希望避免对加密内容（使用 Signal 协议的所有消息）和未加密内容产生任何可能的混淆（通过 SMS 发送的所有消息）在 Signal 应用程序中。 WhatsApp 是欧盟大部分地区最受欢迎的消息平台，但 Android 上从未支持短信。 Android 上剩余的第三方短信应用程序看起来像是一堆劣质广告软件和诈骗软件。 ↩︎︎

entry.title: ★ iOS 大陆漂移扩大
Spotify 希望使用 iPhone 音量按钮来控制连接的设备，但拒绝支持 AirPlay，这可以解决问题
entry.content:
萨拉·佩雷斯 (Sarah Perez) 为 TechCrunch 撰文：

Spotify 声称苹果可能再次违反了欧洲法规《数字市场法案》(DMA)，该法案要求被称为“看门人”的大型科技公司实现互操作性。这一次，问题不是关于应用内购买、链接或定价信息，而是苹果如何停止允许 Spotify 用户控制其连接设备音量的技术。

当通过 iOS 上的 Spotify Connect 串流到连接的设备时，用户以前可以使用 iPhone 侧面的物理按钮来调节音量。由于更改，这将不再有效。为了解决这个问题，Spotify iOS 用户将被引导使用应用程序中 Spotify Connect 菜单中的音量滑块来控制连接设备的音量。

该公司指出，此问题不会影响控制 iOS 蓝牙或 AirPlay 会话音量的用户，也不会影响 Android 上的用户。它仅适用于通过 iOS 上的 Spotify Connect 收听的用户。

谁应该决定 iPhone 和 iPad 上硬件音量按钮的工作规则？苹果还是欧盟委员会？

entry.title: 利兹·切尼：“我不仅不会投票给唐纳德·特朗普，而且还会投票给卡马拉·哈里斯”
entry.content:
安妮·卡尼 (Annie Karni)，《纽约时报》报道：

在杜克大学的一次活动中，切尼女士告诉学生，如果她打算采取一切必要措施阻止特朗普再次入主白宫，那么仅仅反对前总统是不够的，正如她长期以来所做的那样她说会的。

“我认为我们没有资格写下候选人的名字，尤其是在摇摆州，”切尼女士在竞争激烈的北卡罗来纳州对学生们说。 “作为一名保守派，作为一个相信并关心宪法的人，我对此进行了深入思考，并且由于唐纳德·特朗普带来的危险，我不仅不会投票给唐纳德·特朗普，而且我会投票给卡马拉·哈里斯”。

在她做出了意想不到的宣布后，房间里爆发出欢呼声。

I have so much respect for Cheney.她的父亲也是，但他已经退休了。利兹·切尼在作为全国最有影响力的共和党人之一时就采取了这一原则立场。在政治上我变得保守。我在政治上反对民主党。利兹·切尼是一位保守派，并且像她的父亲一样，支持与卡马拉·哈里斯截然不同的政策。但是（小写“d”）民主政治应该被视为非常像心理学中的马斯洛需求层次论。有些事情比其他事情更重要。没有什么比支持民主本身和法治更重要的了——气候变化或环境，生育权，当然也不是他妈的税率。我们要做好其他事情（这确实非常重要）的唯一方法是通过民主治理和法治。

特朗普百分百反民主党，但他并不是保守派。我不支持或认可里根/布什/切尼的政治观点，但这种观点是连贯的。特朗普根本不拥护任何一致的观点。他确实试图推翻 2020 年选举的结果。他是个罪犯。他精神错乱， 衰老，在我们眼前衰弱。 “我不喜欢民主党”——特朗普在选票上，民意调查也处于获胜的误差范围内——在政治需求层次上不够高，无法投票给卡马拉·哈里斯以外的任何人。

如果民主党候选人是一个像特朗普一样衰老、狡猾的疯子，我会毫不犹豫地投票给共和党人利兹·切尼等人竞选总统。没有任何关于“写下”非候选人名字的矫揉造作的废话。没有抗议投票给第三方候选人。下一任总统要么是卡马拉·哈里斯，要么是唐纳德·特朗普，两人中只有一个相信这个伟大国家所代表的一切。

entry.title: 特朗普在新书中威胁扎克伯格“终身监禁”
entry.content:
亚历克斯·伊森斯塔特（Alex Isenstadt）为 Politico 撰文：

特朗普撰写的一本咖啡桌书《拯救美国》于 9 月 3 日出版，其中包括一张特朗普在白宫与扎克伯格会面的照片（未注明日期）。在照片下，特朗普写道，扎克伯格“会来椭圆形办公室见我。他会带着他非常好的妻子来参加晚宴，表现得像任何人一样友善，同时总是密谋安装可耻的锁箱，这是一场针对总统的真正阴谋。”特朗普补充道，他指的是扎克伯格和他的妻子普里西拉捐赠的4.2 亿美元Chan 在 2020 年选举期间提出，旨在为选举基础设施提供资金。

entry.title: 'Founder Mode'

The theme of Brian's talk was that the conventional wisdom about how to run larger companies is mistaken. As Airbnb grew, well-meaning people advised him that he had to run the company in a certain way for it to scale. Their advice could be optimistically summarized as “hire good people and give them room to do their jobs.” He followed this advice and the results were disastrous. So he had to figure out a better way on his own, which he did partly by studying how Steve Jobs ran Apple. So far it seems to be working. The audience at this event included a lot of the most successful founders we've funded, and one after another said that the same thing had happened to them. They'd been given the same advice about how to run their companies as they grew, but instead of helping their companies, it had damaged them.

Apple Original Films had originally promised writer-director Jon Watts and co-stars George Clooney and Brad Pitt a wide theatrical release for their upcoming (and seemingly well-reviewed) movie Wolfs . But, pretty much at the last minute, Apple canceled those plans, and instead will screen it in limited theaters for one week before streaming it on Apple TV+ at the end of this month.

David Canfield interviewed Watts for Vanity Fair , where Watts said he only found out about the change in plans a few days before it was announced:

Canfield: As somebody who's worked in indies, who's worked in the MCU, and has now made a standalone studio movie, how do you see the state of theatrical versus streaming, especially given the pivot with this movie? Does it concern you at all?

entry.title: 1Password and Charging for SSO
entry.content:
My thanks to 1Password — which, earlier this year, acquired frequent DF sponsor Kolide — for sponsoring last week at DF. Imagine if you went to the movies and they charged $8,000 for popcorn. Or, imagine you got on a plane and they told you that seatbelts were only available in first class. Your sense of outraged injustice would probably be something like what IT and security professionals feel when a software vendor hits them with the dreaded SSO tax — the practice of charging an outrageous premium for Single Sign-On, often by making it part of a product's “enterprise tier”. The jump in price can be astonishing — one CRM charges over 5000% more for the tier with SSO. At those prices, only very large companies can afford to pay for SSO. But the problem is that companies of all sizes need it.

Until outraged customers can shame vendors into getting rid of the tax , many businesses have to figure out how to live without SSO. For them, the best route is likely to be a password manager, which also reduces weak and re-used credentials, and enables secure sharing across teams. And a password manager is likely a good investment anyway, for apps that aren't integrated with SSO. To learn more about the past, present, and future of the SSO tax, read 1Password's full blog post .

entry.title: What to Do With Unwanted Political Spam Texts
entry.content:
From Apple's own documentation for the “Delete and Report Junk” feature in Messages:

The sender's information and the message are sent to Apple, and the message is permanently deleted from your iPhone.

If you accidentally report and delete messages, you can recover them.

Reporting junk or spam doesn't prevent the sender from sending messages, but you can block the number to stop receiving them.

Via Andrew Leahey , responding to Marco Arment on Mastodon.

I've been inundated with spam text messages from Democratic political campaigns and PACs for the last year. I know why: because in the past, my wife and I have both contributed to Democratic political campaigns. I add my wife here, because for whatever reason, a good chunk of the political text message spam I get is addressed to “Amy”, not me, and the opposite is true for her. But: every time I have ever contributed money to a political campaign — or to any charity — I pay close attention to any checkboxes allowing me to “opt out” of any further marketing communications. That doesn't seem to matter. Stores and charities are pretty bad at honoring this, but political campaigns are the absolute worst.

For several months this year — while receiving, I'd say, around half a dozen such messages per day, every day, every week — I tried using Messages's “Delete and Report Junk” feature. As far as I can tell it didn't do a damn thing. Now that I see Apple's own documentation, I can see why. Using this feature doesn't even block the sender from sending more messages.

About a month ago I switched tactics and started responding to all such messages with “STOP”. I usually send it in all caps, just like that, because I'm so annoyed. I resisted doing this until a month ago thinking that sending any reply at all to these messages, including the magic “STOP” keyword, would only serve to confirm to the sender that an actual person was looking at the messages sent to my phone number. But this has actually worked. Election season is heating up but I'm getting way way fewer political spam texts now. Your mileage may vary, but for me, the “STOP” response works.

Two other observations:

  • Every single unwanted text message I've gotten in the past few years — every one — has been an SMS message, not iMessage. iMessage spam exists, but for me at least it's a night-and-day difference from SMS. I fail to see how RCS won't be just as bad or worse (because it supports larger images) than SMS in this regard. Apple should have let carrier-based messaging wither on the vine .

  • Almost every single text message this year sent to my personal phone number that I'd describe as “spam” was an attempt to get to me to contribute to a political campaign. I get random phishing texts sent to the public phone number I use for Signal and WhatsApp (which I encourage you to use to contact me, if you prefer, instead of email), but that's to be expected, and those don't come to消息。 It doesn't feel like merely a minor inconvenience for having contributed to US political campaigns in the past — it feels like punishment. Like anyone who gives to a political campaign is a sucker. It's absolutely infuriating. I care deeply about US politics, particularly in this ongoing Trump era, but these spam text messages absolutely have made me less willing to contribute money to campaigns and causes I believe in. Political consultants may well have analytics that show that these spams-to-people-who've-previously-donated-money-to-our-side “work”, but for me — and many of my friends — it has had the opposite effect. I've contributed significantly less money this year than in 2020 — and I now avoid ever donating small amounts to down-ballot campaigns — and the one and only reason why is that I'm annoyed that my previous contributions directly led Democratic campaigns and PACs to send me a zillion spam texts. Not only have I never, in my life, given a penny to any group whom I feel is spamming me, but this has made me gun-shy about contributing any money at all. I'll never ever give out my actual phone number or email address to any political campaign ever again. They clearly have no respect for my time and attention. I think they've talked themselves into thinking this strategy “works” because it works for some of the previous donors they spam with new solicitations, but their analytics won't show the people like me who just stop or greatly decrease their contributions without clicking any of their links. I suppose their analytics can count the “STOP” responses I've started sending, but I doubt they can correlate those “STOP”s with my drop-off in contributions.

entry.title: 'How Telegram Played Itself'
entry.content:
Casey Newton, writing at Platformer:

Telegram is often described as an “encrypted” messenger. But as Ben Thompson explains today , Telegram is not end-to-end encrypted, as rivals WhatsApp and Signal are. (Its “secret chat” feature is end-to-end encrypted, but it is not enabled on chats by default. The vast majority of chats on Telegram are not secret chats.) That means Telegram can look at the contents of private messages, making it vulnerable to law enforcement requests for that data.

Anticipating these requests, Telegram created a kind of jurisdictional obstacle course for law enforcement that (it says) none of them have successfully navigated so far.From the FAQ again :

To protect the data that is not covered by end-to-end encryption, Telegram uses a distributed infrastructure. Cloud chat data is stored in multiple data centers around the globe that are controlled by different legal entities spread across different jurisdictions. The relevant decryption keys are split into parts and are never kept in the same place as the data they protect. As a result, several court orders from different jurisdictions are required to force us to give up any data. […] To this day, we have disclosed 0 bytes of user data to third parties, including governments.

As a result, investigation after investigation finds that Telegram is a significant vector for the spread of CSAM. (To take only the most recent example, here's one from India's Decode last month , which like others found that criminals often advertise their wares on Instagram and direct buyers to Telegram to complete their purchases.) [...]

“Telegram is another level,” Brian Fishman, Meta's former anti-terrorism chief, wrote in a post on Threads . “It has been the key hub for ISIS for a decade. It tolerates CSAM. Its ignored reasonable [law enforcement] engagement for YEARS. It's not 'light' content moderation; it's a different approach entirely.

From the Ben Thompson piece yesterday that Newton links to above, is this description of just how unusual Telegram's “secret chats” are:

That is why “encryption” in the context of messaging means end-to-end encryption; this means that your messages are encrypted on your device and can only ever be decrypted and thus read by your intended recipient. Telegram does support this with “Secret Chats”, but these are not the default. Moreover, Telegram's implementation has a lot of oddities, including some non-standard encryption techniques, the fact that secret chats can only be between two devices (not two accounts, so you can't access a secret chat started on your phone from your computer), and that both users have to be online at the same time to initiate a secret chat (I'll come back to these oddities in a moment).

With a simple prompt, you can add things to photos that were never there. And the company's Gemini AI makes it look astonishingly realistic. This all happens right from the phone's default photo editor app. In about five seconds.

Are we ready to go down this path? Now that the embargo has lifted, let me show you some examples.系好安全带。

The images you'll see in this thread are all straight out of Google Photos after going through Reimagine / Magic Editor. They were never touched up by Photoshop or Lightroom.

On the one hand, this technology becoming ubiquitous feels inevitable. On the other hand, these examples from Welch are disturbing.

At The Verge, Jess Weatherbed writes :

Just because you have the estimable ability to clock when an image is fake doesn't mean everyone can. Not everyone skulks around on tech forums (we love you all, fellow skulkers), so the typical indicators of AI that seem obvious to us can be easy to miss for those who don't know what signs to look for — if they're even there at all. AI is rapidly getting better at producing natural-looking images that don't have seven fingers or Cronenberg-esque distortions.

Maybe it was easy to spot when the occasional deepfake was dumped into our feeds, but the scale of production has shifted seismically in the last two years alone. It's incredibly easy to make this stuff, so now it's fucking everywhere . We are dangerously close to living in a world in which we have to be wary about being deceived by every single image put in front of us.

That's seemingly where we're headed. Everyone alive today has grown up in a world where you can't believe everything you read. Now we need to adapt to a world where that applies just as equally to photos and videos. Trusting the sources of what we believe is becoming more important than ever.

See also: “ Elmo drunk driving and holding a beer .”

entry.title: Sonos CEO Says Their Old App Can't Be Rereleased
entry.content:
Jay Peters, writing for The Verge last week:

If you want the old Sonos app back, it's not coming. In a Reddit AMA response posted Tuesday, Sonos CEO Spence says that he was hopeful “until very recently” that the company could rerelease the app, confirming a report from The Verge that the company was considering doing so. But after testing that option, rereleasing the old app would apparently make things worse, Spence says.

Since the new app was released on May 7th, Spence has issued a formal apology and announced in August that the company would bedelaying the launch of two products “until our app experience meets the level of quality that we, our customers, and our partners expect from Sonos.”

Here's Spence's explanation as to why it can't bring back the old app:

The trick of course is that Sonos is not just the mobile app, but software that runs on your speakers and in the cloud too. In the months since the new mobile app launched we've been updating the software that runs on our speakers and in the cloud to the point where today S2 is less reliable & less stable then what you remember. After doing extensive testing we've reluctantly concluded that re-releasing S2 would make the problems worse, not better. I'm sure this is disappointing. It was disappointing to me.

The new Sonos app is looking more and more like an entry for the Unpopular Redesigns Hall of Fame.

entry.title: 1Password: The Infinite Loop of Security
entry.content:
My thanks to 1Password — which, earlier this year, acquired frequent DF sponsor Kolide — for sponsoring last week at DF. The 2024 Verizon Data Breach Investigations Report (DBIR) found that “the human element” (accidental breaches caused by human error, or victimization in phishing attacks and the like) was the number one cause of breaches. The same was true last year, and the year before that, and the year before that.

The single biggest culprit in breaches continues to be weak and stolen credentials. The 2024 DBIR found that “use of stolen credentials” is the number one initial action during a breach, and that credentials are the number one way attackers gain access in non-error, non-misuse breaches, followed by phishing and vulnerability exploits. This needs to change, and the 2024 DBIR offers a clear look at where we're falling short and where we go from here. To get more insights about the report and its implications for security, read the full post on 1Password's blog .

entry.content:
回到当天，在经典的Mac OS上，软件没有“特权”。如果您启动了一个应用程序或安装了系统扩展程序，则该软件只能完成所需的内容。像游戏一样（看似）无害的东西，或者像磁盘格式化实用程序一样强大...运行。如果该磁盘实用程序有一个错误，可以覆盖您的启动磁盘的每个字节，零，那么运气就很难。如果您不幸地安装了像病毒一样传播的恶意软件，那么运气甚至更艰难。这听起来很糟糕，但是实际上，很好。自1991年以来，我一直在使用Mac，但我再也不记得一次（不是一次）在恶意软件或扫描方面遇到问题。 1

那是很久以前的事了。

这样的自由放任方法显然今天不会飞行。我希望我的Mac上的大多数应用程序都可以在沙箱中运行。我希望应用程序需要明确的权限才能访问相机和麦克风，或者捕获显示器的内容。我希望应用程序在已知的开发人员签名并默认情况下由Apple进行公证。 But I also want to be able to grant trusted applications non-sandboxed access to my entire file system, access to cameras and microphones, and the ability to capture my screen.

我本周发布了 一系列链接，介绍了MacOS中的反恶意软件/反scamware保护措施越来越多地从“这是合理的平衡”到“这是令人发指的”。它确实正在完全变成苹果曾经嘲笑的东西。

Mac是一个平台，您需要能够在脚上开枪。显然，增加的保护措施使您的脚射击不太可能是一个好主意。他们中的许多是必要的。但是，这种保护只有在使用需要高度系统特权的软件的精致用户的方式时，无疑是好主意。然后他们成为权衡。随着苹果公司在MacOS中增加了这样的保护，有些电力用户都会感到烦恼，但我认为，直到最近，Apple还是很好地管理了这一平衡。总体而言，MACOS对不老练的用户非常热情且安全，同时对专家保持强大而有效。但是近年来，Macos显然已经开始滑落过防护性的滑坡。

可以提醒您已安装的软件，或者完全需要访问私人数据和敏感的硬件API。很高兴被提醒您可能已安装的任何软件，而该软件在不知情或回忆的情况下获得了此类权限。 （例如，如果一个虐待合作伙伴安装了某种监视软件对您而言。同样的软件，当您需要深入到系统设置中的三个或四个级别以执行此操作时，情况甚至更糟。

考虑现实世界的电动工具。没有人愿意受伤。当然，没有人愿意失去手指。但是，严重的工具用户仍然有钻孔，木头的钻孔和钉子的钉子。公司周围有一个引人入胜的传奇，该公司发明了一种用于桌子锯技术的技术，该技术使用电容式传感器来防止锯通过手指切片（或者说是出于演示目的，热狗）。到十年前，仅在美国，每年在桌子上切下4000多个手指。 That's a lot of fingers. Sawstop的技术几乎可以防止所有此类事故。但这也是：它不会使木锯割木头更糟。该公司有一个关于切湿或“绿色”木材的常见问题解答：

锯锯锯毫无问题地切割了大多数湿木。但是，如果木材非常绿色或湿润（例如，切割时足够湿，可以在切割时喷洒雾），或者木材既湿润又经过压力处理，则木材可能足够导电以激活制动器。 If you are unsure whether the material you need to cut is conductive, you can make test cuts using Bypass Mode to determine if it will activate the safety system's brake.控制盒上的红灯将闪烁以表示电导率。如果材料是导电的，您可以选择以旁路模式操作锯，这将使SAW安全系统的制动功能脱离，并允许您继续切割材料。

这听起来像是MacOS的正确平衡 - 直到最近取得的平衡MacOS。默认情况下，安全性，但不要阻碍电源用户的工作。而且，当用户需要覆盖安全功能时，就会有一个覆盖，并且情况将为用户清楚地表明需要使用替代的用户是由安全问题证明的。 MACOS正在转向需要翻转覆盖切换的电力用户领域。

在Mac用户群的两个极端情况下，技术上没有技术上的NAIF和持怀疑态度的专家Power用户。苹果公司以加强技术不合适的护栏的名义，提供一些对专家电力用户不需要的保护是公平的。但是，在某个时候，锤子需要锤击什么，有时是用户的拇指。那是Mac。这是一个Unix工作站，足够友好，可以被大众市场使用。它不是旨在防止任何可能的恶意软件或骗局运行的设备。

苹果制作这样的设备。他们运行iOS。我甚至说Mac面临的一个问题与Mac本身无关，而是iPad弱点的下游效果。我相信在1984年的口号中，Mac是“我们其他人的计算机”，“我们其他人”非常包含非专家用户。但是，对于某些用户而言，Mac成为不适当的平台，这是一个不适当的观点和Okey Doke的易情。也有许多施工专业的电动工具，也不应由非专家用户使用。

Computers are such an essential part of the modern world — and almost everyone's daily lives — that computers-that-work-like-computers aren't for everyone.全世界都需要锁定的不可能限制自己的fingers，例如iPad等您做什么平台。苹果公司的iPad单位比MAC销量要多得多。但是，任何未充分使用MacOS中的反恶意软件/扫描软件保护措施的MAC用户都不应该使用Mac。他们应该使用iPad或其他类似锁定的东西。这些用户中的一些是出于无知而不是iPad。 iPad可以满足他们的技术需求，但他们不知道。 （根据定义，它们在技术上是没有老师的。）但是，当然有些人知道他们宁愿使用iPad代替Mac，但不能使用iPad，但由于iPad不能做他们需要做的事情或多个事情，或运行他们需要运行的软件。

电动工具和用户安全功能并非相互排斥。但是他们需要保持平衡。苹果显然正在与MacOS失去这种平衡，我认为其中很大一部分是iPad的弱点在缩小规模。

  1. 对于经典的Mac OS用户而言，病毒，恶意软件和扫描件并不是重大问题，并不意味着这些事情不存在。实际上，在1980年代末和1990年代初，有一系列病毒，由约翰·诺斯塔德（John Norstad）的免费软件防病毒系统扩展称为“消毒剂” 。但是总的来说，整个经典Mac OS的整个十年时代都没有太多恶意软件。其中的一部分是根据设计，部分是由安全性与实力相关的，也许是好运的一部分。 ↩︎

entry.summary: Apple's success with services is no more a distraction from their core business than their success with their own chain of retail stores has been.
entry.content:
Jason Snell, “ Existential Thoughts About Apple's Reliance on Services Revenue ”:

The intersection of hardware and software has been Apple's home address since the 1970s. And yet, a few years ago, Apple updated its marketing language and began to refer to Apple's secret sauce as the combination of “hardware, software, and services.” [...]

Last quarter, Apple made about $22 billion in profit from products and $18 billion from Services. It's the closest those two lines have ever come to each other.

This is what was buzzing in the back of my head as I was going over all the numbers on Thursday. We're not quite there yet, but it's hard to imagine that there won't be a quarter in the next year or so in which Apple reports more total profit on Services than on products.

When that happens, is Apple still a products company? Or has it crossed some invisible line?

What a great column from Snell. One way to look at it — as Snell points out in the first paragraph quoted above — is that Apple has always been a two-sided coin. They are the company that best exemplifies Alan Kay's adage : “People who are really serious about software should make their own hardware.” Apple has always been like one of those optical illusions that looks like one thing at first, but looks like another if you stare at it for a few seconds . A hardware company that makes great software. A software company that makes great hardware.

Coins only have two sides though. If services constitute a new third dimension for the company, and we carry this analogy through, it's like a coin whose edge just keeps getting thicker. If the edge gets thick enough, it's no longer a coin — it's something else. A stick or a baton.

But another way to look at it is that services are just another form of software. Software that runs not on the personal computing devices Apple sells to customers, but which run on servers in the cloud. And, importantly, is sold to users via lucrative recurring subscriptions. Content often isn't what we think of as software (like say music, movies, and TV shows) but content from the App Store is. But the key is that it's all stuff that the users of Apple's devices consume on those devices. Apple's core business is designing, engineering, producing, and selling those devices. Services are just a huge, and growing, part of what users do and consume on those devices.

To extend Kay's axiom for today's world, I suspect Apple's leadership sees things this way: People who are really serious about device platforms should make their own services. Viewed that way, Apple's success with services is no more a distraction from their core business than their success with their own chain of retail stores has been. It's just a necessary evolution.
